description:
Business lunches give me an opportunity to try places I normally wouldn't try.  When my business friend chose this old time place in the Financial District, I grinned and remembered I'd never tried this place.  Belden Alley especially in the evening reminds us of being in Europe where there are sidewalk tables and seating while no vehicles drive by.  There are a number restaurants in this alley, from Peruvian, French, and Spanish to Italian, the cuisine here.  

Coming in around noon, we were offered an outside table but, since there would be business discussed, opted for an inside table on the left.  My friend didn't recognize the host as he is a frequent diner and knew one of the partners pretty well.  Turned out is was his day off.  After studying the menu, nothing really piqued my curiosity but he did mention a special that day, I believe.  I tried the grilled prawns with penne pasta (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=X0kQ_hCZghA1_Hzs_27EjA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  It was nicely done, not overly sauced and everything was cooked to the perfect temperature from pasta, prawns, and sauce.  The sprinkled Parmesan gave it a little richness and a change in texture for each bite.  While waiting for our food, we worked through our bread basket pretty quickly prompting me to ask for a refill.  I used a slice to wipe my plate clean of the sauce... who needs a dishwasher, kidding.

Our host actually took our order while another younger gentleman served our food, bussed our table, and refilled our drink glasses.  The dining room was about a half full, likely with other diners who worked in the area.  It was a relaxed lunch and the noise level was good as we were able to iron out details about our meeting.  With all of the Italian restaurant options in North Beach, this will likely be my spot if meeting someone working in the Financial District or downtown area.
author: Mike C.

description:
Classic ristorante. Same owner for past 27 years. Our first time was circa 1998. Haven't dined here for sometime. Came back this evening for dinner date with hubby... Same decor, nicely upkept, very Italiano vibe. Although I did miss the Italian servers from before. The owner back in the days was quite the management... Managing every staff from the front point of ristorante to the kitchen and back. But today he is still very hands on managing as the evening host. Taking customers to their table and handing them checks. 

Hubby ordered lamb... He was very pleased. The taste is still the same like when we first dined. Meat was made to perfection... Not over cooked, beautiful pink inside with no signs of red juice spilling out, the lamb had a nice crunchy texture and nut burnt. Topped with mashed potatoes and bed of fresh sauteed spinach. 

I had their petrole fish. Made well... Sitting on top of risotto with green peas and hints of jalapeno slices. Very light and delicioso. 

We also shared the mussels. And the tomato red sauce broth is still the same. 

Really 3.5 stars. 
Service is decent
Food is excellent
Amazed to see owner and still rocking it. Business can be challenging. But glad to see home till hold up this belden lane gem. This is where I ranked highly. 

Buon apetito
author: Wen L.

description:
Belden Place is a wonderful restaurant Lane.  The best way to describe it is "Fidi European Lane".  As soon as you enter the street you have to make a difficult choice, Italian, French, Spanish?  What does my taste buds fancy today?  We got there right before the rush around 11:50.  The best time to go there is between 11:30-12 before the rush.  When our weather is 70's, it is ideal to sit outside.  The Lane can be drafty so bring a light jacket.  Needless to say the parking around here is impossible so Uber or Lyft.  The ambience is very much like Europe.  Casual dining.  Right outside each restaurant is the menu so you check menus out before you decide.

We were a party of three and opted for Italian.  Although not the best in town, it is solid with a great menu selection.  Ask them for the specials before you sit.  Usually there is and appetizer, a fish, a pasta special.  We were all on light carb day so we ordered the octopus salad, cioppino, salmon and of course my Mediterranean branzino.  The octopus salad was definitely a flop.  Presented beautifully but way to over powered with capers so salty and the texture was not there.  The cioppino was a little too rich for my taste.  Salmon is slightly smaller than I thought but good.  So why did I give them 4?  Two reasons: the branzino was prepped just like I like it, simple and whole.  I never let others debone my fish because that is how I know if the chef appreciates the fish.  The meat barely fell off the bone.  Perfect.  The best part of the fish is the belly and the head.  As I am deboning I was salivating.  I can already taste the fried garlic and sage and the eyes...yes I and one of those.  Second reason?  Manager was wonderful.  We did not order a dessert but needless to say, Tiramisu must have tiramisu right?  Indeed.  He gave us a piece on the house and wow!  It was light, and beautifully done slightly different from the traditional recipe.  It was done with Kahlua rather than rum.  Over a million pieces served in 30 years!  The cream was light and tasty.  Rounded my lunch with an awesome cappuccino.  I was a happy camper for a Monday lunch.

Definitely a visit especially if you crave fish head and eyes..with tiramisu.  until next time bon appetit and ciao.
author: Dee Dee L.

description: Wonderful birthday dinner at our favorite Belden Place ristorante..always tasty sauces and subtle flavors.
author: Donna C.

description: Consistently tasty Italian cuisine that makes you savor every bite. Be sure to listen carefully to the specials of he day because they are usually very good, as is the rest of the menu. On my most recent visit, I had the fish special which was excellent, cooked to perfection with thin crispy skin, over a bed of vegetables tinged with just the right amount of capers and a little thin sauce. The price for the fish and most dishes are within reasonable ($22 for the fish dish I had) and not the most expensive but also not the cheapest. The location is in a European style alley with indoor and outdoor seating. Very charming. We had nice weather but when it's cold or rainy, then seating can be challenging. I just wished the city would re-pave the street because of the roughness of the well-worn asphalt. Service is very good. Because prices can add up, we didn't drink anything other than water and we did not have dessert or coffee on this recent trip. But I have had the tiramisu many times and it is delicious and you must try it at least once when eating here.
author: Lucy L.

description: Meal was excellent and was easy to get to. I ordered with Mealpal and when I got there it was like the meal had been sitting there. Luckily my office has an oven so I warmed it up and mixed the noodles with the sauce to get them moist again. Otherwise great tasting as Italian is my favorite cuisine. Will return again outside of Mealpal and with Mealpal . Just have to make sure I schedule early pickup as to advise the sitting out problem.
author: William F.

description:
First time here last night. Small place hidden in alley-like location. 
I definitely loved the seafood risotto and wished one more shrimp included with the serving. The sauce was delicious; the mushroom was tasty. 
Also loved the sauce of meatball dish. Lamb chops were tender and polenta was good. Tiramisu cake was delicious as well.  I think a little work on food presentation would go a longer way, but I definitely enjoyed the taste of each dish. 
Looking forward to trying something with lobster or crab next time :)
author: Ariene S.

description: Nothing to said the worst Italian restaurant in the country
author: Cris V.

description: So surprised this place is still here. Still awful service, and food didn't look good. This place has to be a front for something
author: Mike S.

description: I'm giving four stars just because I would love the waiter was more relax or nice he was to busy or seemed like it. But the food was delicious. My husband and I definitely coming back. Recommended
author: Veronica H.

description: We came here for a family dinner last Saturday night and we had so much fun and the food was fantastic. The owner was our waiter for the night and he was so nice and made sure we loved his food. He even gave me a hug when we were done. Highly recommend this family restaurant. Great location and wheelchair accessible.  The bathroom is downstairs so it isn't accessible.
author: Jodie G.

description:
Worst restaurant experience ever, do not go here. The service was terrible. We had to remind our waiter to bring our drinks at least four times, they were only brought after we had FINISHED our appetizers. When he did finally bring our drinks he forgot one of them. He forgot to put in an order for one of our entrees, and it was only brought after everyone else had finished eating. We were clearly displeased and our waiter did nothing to make up for his mistakes, in fact he even charged us twice for an appetizer. No apologies or anything.

To top it all off the oysters gave us food poisoning.
author: Molly O.

description: Had a great fun time here with 10 friends and the food and service was great!! Great portions , the pork chop was heavenly! The deserts were great too! Love Belden Lane a hidden flavor town!!!
author: John W.

description:
The ambiance of this cute Café was very nice. We arrived around 11:50 am before it got too busy. We did not have reservations and got seated right away outside. They have plenty of outdoor seating/ indoor seating. Our server was very courteous and informed us of specials of the day.

We ordered the Bruschetta as an appetizer. Unfortunately, the bread was burnt and that was all I could taste. 

The menu had lots of options from appetizers, salads and more filling entrees. I opted for a small salad with Chicken, but I was told they had run out? The goat cheese on the salad was very delicious and complimented the balsamic vinaigrette very well.

We received complimentary bread right before our meals arrived. This was odd being as though the guests sitting beside us got seated after and were served with both before us.

Overall, the atmosphere is very nice. The staff is very polite. They were understaffed and we had to get their attention a few times to ask for our bill. I will say their menu is very well thought out, unique and their plating was beautiful. 
I would not come here again, but this place has lots of potential in the FiDi.
author: Kam H.

description:
Good food in a cool location! In a small alley way full of restaurants it gives off comfortable vibes where you can get a sit down for a meal.

Got the meatballs and polenta for lunch. The meats were a little over worked, the polenta was a great level of heaviness, and the sauce was the right proportion. Would be interested in seeing this place for dinner
author: Bito M.

description:
I took my wife out for her birthday dessert since her favorite is tiramisu. She remembered loving the tiramisu at Cafe Tiramisu so we went out of our way with great anticipation, got a table, and then we were told we couldn't order dessert without ordering something off of the main menu. Being full from eating dinner before, we decided to leave.

In retrospect, I should have demanded to speak with the manager, but at the time I was just disappointed and a little in shock. That said, we did end up finding some tiramisu right across the street at a pizza place, which kind of ruined her night.
author: Jaimie S.

description:
We recently bought an apartment in Scalea, Italy and one of the benefits has been the recommendations we've got for restaurants owned by Scalea expats in the SF Bay Area. Cafe Tiramisu was recommended to us by two separate friends there, both in the restaurant business. Sounded good to us, so we recently had dinner there with some friends. We're so glad we did. First off, we had never been to Belden Place, what a cute little alley lined with restaurants, very European. Cafe Tiramisu is a  beautiful, comfy, inviting, place.
 The other half of our party had smooth sailing into the city and arrived half hour early for our six o'clock reservation, as the weather was bad they headed straight to the restaurant.  They texted us that they were seated quickly and were already having drinks. When we arrived, we joined them and we also had our drink orders taken immediately, nice way to start an evening.
  The menu covered a lot of territory and it was hard to make a descision, and we weren't rushed. I'd say service was very attentive without any feeling of being rushed. To start  our friends ordered salads and we ordered a cauliflower puree soup. The salads were beautiful. One a caesar and the other mixed greens, our friends said they were perfect.  I almost wished I had ordered a salad, that is until I tasted my soup. It was to die for, very complex but smooth flavors, I could have had seconds, maybe thirds. 
For main courses we ordered, linguine with clams, papardelle with meat sauce, salmon on a bed of saffron orange sauce topped with a crab hash and whole Branzino fish. We all agreed that our dishes were excellent. I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu.
We also had desserts, the tiramisu and cannoli. We're Tiramisu fans that and this was excellent. I've never been a bit fan of Cannoli, but that's just changed. These were heaven, light crispy containers holding a most wonderful filling, again very   complex but subtle flavors.
Presentation on all the dishes was beautiful. The kitchen here really knows their stuff. Its flavors you expect with hints of something special.
Wait service was on point, as I said attentive but not pushy in any way. Prices were reasonable, especially for the quality of food.
We'll be coming back.
author: Vince S.

description:
This review is extremely overdue, as in like YEARS overdue, but here it is! 

I have been to Cafe Tiramisu numerous times and every single time I eat here I am reminded of why this establishment is fantastic. First of all, the food is out of this world. The lamb and sole are my personal favorites, however there really isn't a bad dish on the menu. The Jalapeño crab risotto is 10/10 and easily my favorite item to accompany any dish.  My girlfriend loves the spinach and cheese ravioli and that's all she gets! Also, all of their pasta is made in house and is extremely fresh. On second thought, everything has always been extremely fresh. This is due to the fact that the menu is designed around what foods are the freshest at certain times of year. Don't expect the menu to be the same all year long because the owner likes to rotate it as the seasons change. 

The ambiance at Cafe Tiramisu is amazing. Whenever I walk in through the front door it feels like a trip to Italy. It can be a perfect social setting or a more romantic setting depending on which you are going for. The service is great. I could spend hours admiring this restaurant and how beautifully decorated it is. I never want my visit here to end. 

The dessert is amazing especially the Tiramisu!

If you're debating on restaurants to visit in the city give this place a shot as you will not be disappointed!
author: Anthony F.

description: UPDATE: This place went from 3 stars down to 1 due to the fact that they manipulated the bill & added an additional $40 per credit card. We each tipped them fairly well. So is the lunch Sea bass $27 or 67??
author: Adrianna J.

description: This place is amazing!  The food, service was beyond the best!  I would come again the next time I'm in town.  In addition, the price was reasonable.
author: Li L.

description: Loved this restaurant! Food was delicious. All four of us loved our meal - swordfish, salmon, steak and pasta. Now that says something. Service was awesome as well. Highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Kathie J.

description: My wife and I enjoyed an excellent meal at Cafe Tiramisu .  I wish I could provide a 6 star rating for the quality of food and service.  Our favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco!!
author: Steve T.

description: We chose this restaurant to celebrate our 27th Anniversary on the recommendation of the concierge at our hotel. We were not disappointed- service was excellent and friendly without being intrusive. The owner came around and told us of the specials. We enjoyed salads - and then Pappardelle  and Ossobucco - both were delicious. We finished with a 20 year old port and a Fog City and split a House made tiramisu- Best tiramisu we've ever had! Wish we would've found this place earlier in our trip because we would've been back several times!
author: Jim E.

description: Here for a conference so I stopped here with coworkers after finding the  place through open table.  Just wow. The place itself is so charming and the food was amazing. We did some appetizers of the meatballs, bruschetta and prosciutto. Highly recommend the meatballs- they were awesome!  I got the risotto with mushrooms and shrimp, so delicious. Everyone loved their meals and of course we had to finish with tiramisu.  Wish I lived here because I would go be back regularly. I can see how some people might get annoyed about the speed of service but we didn't mind, gave us to chat and enjoy our drinks.
author: Megan P.

description: Service and people were excellent. Food was decent. The reason it gets 3 stars is because everything is not super. The rigatoni was less than great. However, the ricotta raviolis were amazing.
author: Daniel P.

description: Such a cute restaurant in a cute location. I came here for Mother's Day dinner and the food was delicious. I definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Alicia M.

description:
This restaurant is the best Italian I've eaten in a while.
Friendly service and excellent food.
author: Sherry F.

description:
What a nice surprise, a truly amazing, authentic Italian gem here in downtown San Francisco. 
The food is just amazing, the chef definitely knows what he does!!! Not only it tastes good, but also, it is amazingly presented, take a look at my pics!
Bruschetta 10$ and ahi tuna crudo and smoked salmon 13$ are both a must try! Great texture, perfect combination of crunchiness and softness, both really melt in your mouth..literally.
As main courses we shared gnocchi with mushrooms and pancetta 18$, soft, creamy, super tasty and the pappardelle with pork and beef ragu 18$ simple and delicious. Both hand made, tasty but delicate at the same time, absolutely balanced.
My personal advice is SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT!!!! We shared chocolate cake, pear tart, creme brulet and tiramisu, all absolutely to die for!
Service is very attentive and the ambiance is very elegant, beautifully decorated in a kind of pompeian style, very interesting!
Prices are surprisingly reasonable for what you  get. 
I'm extremely pleased about the entire experience, and I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Michelle C.

description: Be brave to walk into the street as a tourist. Half way in you find the restaurant. Definitely a recommendation. Nice wines and decent food at a good price.
author: Snej R.

description: We were lured in by the owner and not disappointed! Authentic & fresh Italian in a unique, old world atmosphere. Definitely a quality experience and would plan to return.
author: Amy R.

description:
Belden place is a kitschy yet cute environment, and though it may seem a bit touristy, Cafe Tiramisu really is a gem amidst all the flurry. I've been here a few times and each time is amazing.  

Pasta is homemade, and fresh ingredients are used throughout. Don't forget to try the grilled octopus, as the combination of flavors will make your taste buds dance.
author: Sherrie P.

description: I just moved I California, someone told me about This restaurant and I think that was delicious , the tomato sauce like my mom makes it.
author: Carletto R.

description:
The bruschetta is amazing. Even if you just came here for that you would be happy. But don't. Stay for the dinner. I had the crab ravioli special and it was excellent. 
Loved the bread and the dipping oil. 
The staff is very friendly and make you feel like you are the most important person in the place.
author: Katherine H.

description: I ate grilled octopus and it was super delicious. I am normally not a huge fan of sea foods but this place made me love it! I recommend octopus for everyone.
author: Zeynep D.

description:
Had a welcome new member team lunch here with my co workers. Decided to try this place since we always go to Plouf. 

Great service and cute little restaurant inside Belden Lane. I got the Risotto. It had mussels and also lobster bisque inside, it was VERY good. I highly recommend! Loved it! The flavors collided great, I was expecting it to be salty, but not at all. My co workers got some other dishes and they also enjoyed their lunch. 

I would come here again, they have really good pasta here, definitely a must try.
author: Natalie L.

description: An absolute gem!  Menu is varied and food is excellent.  Service is helpful and the food is excellent.  The food is excellent and the prices are fair.  The whole experience  is excellent!
author: Sid R.

description:
I am sad that I can't give more starts to this place. We love the Belden street and the feel to it and have tried couple of different places. Although the last time we went there was in the summer and we had a beautiful and fun dinner outside we thought to give it a try in this season again but went to a different place which was Cafe Tiramisu.

 It was a busy Friday night so we waited for a bit and chose the table right by the side walk since we didn't want to wait very long. the service was not good at all, our server seamed upset or irritated, maybe he was tired not sure, but still I think he could of tried to be friendlier. Unfortunately the food was not as great as well and specially for the price and total that we paid for the dinner of two we did not had a greatest experience. 

Also, I know it's not that important but it would be nice to have some updated and less heavy and thick wine glasses.
author: Elly M.

description:
The quality of Cafe Tiramisu isn't the same as it used to be when I first tired this place. I like how they have an outside seating and you have the option to do a fixed price dinner as well. I felt that the appetizers were more tasty than the entires. I was pretty happy with the appetizers but the entrees tasted microwaved and definitely NOT fresh. At least for dessert, the tiramisu was pretty good. 

Appetizers:
- Grilled Octopus with avocado, celery & salmoriglio sauce
- Classic Veal Meatballs over polenta with tomato sauce and dry ricotta
- Bruschetta with fig spread, burratta, prosciutto and aged balsamic

Entrees: (not so good...)
- Ravioli filled with beef shortribs over tomato fondue, sage and garlic chips
- Asparagus and Lemon Risotto with bottarga di tonno
author: Jenn L.

description: Appalling experience. There was a dead mouse in its own vomit under our table and the management did not comp anything or offer to move our table. While they gave us a tiramisu, we didn't even want it. They offered limoncellos to the next table near the mouse (who didn't want them either and also did not get anything comped). In addition, the service was so incredibly slow and the manager came several minutes after the mouse had been discovered...he had been sitting with his friends eating and drinking toward the front of the restaurant. They didn't even clean up the mouse vomit after they removed the carcass. I can't believe the seriously terrible service- the food was ok but was so overshadowed by the unbelievable experience.
author: Rachel Z.

description:
AVOID THIS ESTABLISHMENT!
Mediocre food, carelees waiter experience, the Muscles on the old side and suspect and when my wife asked for cheese on her pasta the waiter questioned it. 

30 years dining experience in this town, been a waiter myself, I must say it is unfortunate that Tiramisu like the rest of Belden Lane have become a tourist trap.

To add, tip fraud committed. I was alerted by my credit card company and learned  someone manipulated my tip and tripled it. AVOID THIS ESTABLISHMENT!
author: Tim P.

description:
I had the $25 prix-fixe lunch menu and chose the Mezze Rigatoni with Italian sausage Bolognese, zucchini and goat cheese for my appetizer; Salmon filet crusted with pumpkin seeds and pesto, and pumpkin puree and balsamic spinach for my main entree. And Profiterole della Casa, basically a small frozen pastry with cream and a bit of chocolate sauce for dessert (there was no option for this).

The rigatoni was really good. Rigatoni had rich nice flavours and you'd think the goat cheese would overpower the bolognese sauce but it didn't. The pasta was also cooked perfectly.  Salmon filet was okay, my rigatoni was much better. It was just really small portions. The salmon was kind of dry and overcooked, but the pesto sauce and pumpkin sauce made up for it. Dessert wasn't too great either because it seemed like it came straight from the freezer.

The bread before the appetizer came with an olive oil dip was quite tasty.

Overall, rigatoni was really good and the salmon filet was okay. So I would come back and would probably stay away from the dry salmon.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Very good Italian food! My Italian friend gave me a glowing recommendation for this place, and it definitely lives up to expectations! I've been here twice, once last year in October and again this October. 

It's in a really cute alley with a bunch of different European restaurants, with a choice of outdoor or indoor seating. The indoor seating is pretty nice and the decor is very Roman, but I think I prefer outdoor seating just because the ambiance is better. 

They change up their menus quite often I think, because I didn't see the same entree I got last year on it this year, nor did I see some of the entrees that other Yelp reviewers are talking about. Last year I got veal scallopini with risotto, which they have changed to pork scallopini. I really liked this dish! The risotto is amazing. I also tried the steak carpaccio last year, which was also delicious. 

This year I split a cheese board with a friend; I'm not very informed on cheese nor do I eat it very often so I can't really give an opinion here. For entree I got linguine with clams, which was really good! Lots of clams and the white wine sauce was very flavorful. The tiramisu here is also really good; one order is a lot though so definitely split it. 

I thought the service was fine too! Although I don't really have high standards for service. Definitely will come again!
author: Melissa H.

description:
I came here with co-workers after two of us saw this on Check Please Bay Area. We were disappointed to not see the short ribs on the lunch menu (as it was online), but we liked everything we got. We started with the meatballs, which were delicious (and could feed one for lunch on its own), and the octopus, which was tender and delicious. 

Two of us had the branzino special, which was perfectly cooked (watch for the bones, though!), which had a sauce with mussels and clams, and nestled on a bed of polenta. The other two had the sole and the salmon, both of which they liked. And, of course, for dessert, the tiramisu, which was light and fluffy and delicious.

No complaints about the service or cleanliness of the place. I'd definitely go there again!
author: Mi M.

description:
Had late 9:30 reservation but when we showed up, was told rudely that they are closing and stopped serving. Bad attitude too, made it sounds like we are a bother by showing up for our reservation.

This used to be one of my favorite place for Tiramasu, but now will have to look for a new place. Thankfully there are many to choose from in The City.
author: Chris T.

description:
I had an amazing experience here. I was here for my 21st birthday before going out with friends and I brought 12 people without reservation on a Saturday night. I felt bad of course, but they had no problem taking us in. 

We were seated pretty quickly and the server, who also seemed like the owner of the restaurant was so funny. He threw in some jokes here and there, made us feel as if we were at his house and having dinner with him. The food was so good and it seemed as if all my friends enjoyed their food also. The presentation was great too, which is a plus!

Also, they brought me a Tiramisu for my birthday and oh gosh. That is the real Tiramisu and it just melted in my mouth. Such a great way to end the meal.
author: Thai C.

description:
Nice service as the waiter was attentive and very nice.  There is really only one dish I would definitely make a return trip for - the Tiramisu.  It was creamy and tasty and large enough to be shared by two.
My corn and leek soup topped with spicy chopped crunchy shrimp was very good.  
The grilled octopus with avocado which had rave reviews by Yelpers was good but not earth shaking. 
Our entrees were good but didn't wow either of us.
Hubby had the seafood risotto over lobster bisque.  There were 11 tiny clams and he liked it.
I had the pan-seared sea bass which was moist but the flavor wasn't exciting.  

We sat upstairs, inside near the stairway which lead to about another 7 tables downstairs. Hubby had to use the bathroom which was located downstairs.  He said the area downstairs had a mildew odor which i also noticed as I sat near the stairs.  It's below street level, really underground so not much aeration.  There are ample tables for outside seating.  I thought it was too cold outside tonight and do not like sitting outside on the alley street.  SF streets are pretty dirty.  We were close to the kitchen and could see how hard the staff works to make our meals.  If you like tiramisu for dessert, you will not be disappointed.
author: Ry T.

description:
I can't believe it took me so long to finally come here. My first reaction after getting started with the appetizers was damn this is really good, then main course was just as great. I knew we had to get dessert. Even though I done have much of a sweet tooth we ended up ordering two rounds of desert.
 The waiter was very knowledgeable on all the dishes. We stared with clams, meatballs & octopus. Very shareable & nice presentation. The main course we got sea bass, salmon & lamb. I eat salmon alot & usually avoid it but after having a bite here I feel back in love with it. 
We couldn't wait to try each others meals because everything was so delicious. For dessert we had to get the tiramisu. Normally I'm dragged into eating some of the dessert with the lady so she doesn't eat it all & her dad doesn't care for sweets. That first bite of tiramisu we all looked at each other with a big smile. After such a great meal this was such a great ending. 
If I didn't live so far away I think I would be here every week. Keep up the good food & I'll keep coming Cafe Tiramisu
author: Fahad L.

description:
Visiting SF during a business trip and stumbled upon this lovely restaurant. Pasta is homemade, lemon cello is DELICIOUS, appetizer of artichoke hearts with cream cheese and pepper sauce, everything was better than I could have ever imagined or hoped for. 
Owner takes care of you, is incredibly attentive, SO personable, absolutely loves what he does and wants to make sure you are enjoying your experience at his restaurant. He is such a hard working, genuine man. Will definitely be back on my next trip to San Francisco and would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone!
author: Cierra E.

description:
Ordered a bunch of plates to share with a friend because we are fatties. The restaurant was relatively empty even at around 7PM but that was probably because it was during the middle of the week. Our server was charming and attentive but service was a bit slow since we were sitting far back in the restaurant, which was quite empty. 

As for food, we had mussels, tuna and salmon crudo with burrata, short rib risotto with scallops, and tomato and corn soup. The mussels and crudo were okay--tasty but nothing exceptional. The soup was delicious and had an addictive smokiness to it, and given the opportunity I could probably finish a tub of it. The freshness of the scallops and micro-greens were a nice balance to the richness and meatiness of the short rib risotto.

The restaurant interior was a very ancient Roman, with frescoes and mosaic-like art on the wall. They have patio seating, and the back dining room has a skylight, which is always nice!
author: Tina X.

description:
The food was good, BUT, I just did not have a good experience here. Came here for lunch the other day. Yes, I admit, during the peek lunch hour in the financial district, service can be a bit slow.  We were seated right away, however, no one took our order for drinks or anything the first 10 minutes we sat down. Complimentary bread finally came and along with that...so did a fat cockroach that ran across our table. And I'm sorry, once you see that, you can't get comfortable and not watch/dissect every forkful that goes in your mouth.

As an app, I ordered the black peppered beef carpaccio. That was amazing!! One of the best I've ever had. Caprese salad was good.  You can tell the cheese was fresh mozzarella.  The pear arugula salad was also pretty good. The pear was purple (infused with wine) with gorgonzola.  

I ordered the shellfish linguine and when I got my dish, naturally I asked for cheese for the whole table and then I was kinda of embarrassed for asking for it.  Our waiter was grilling me about ruining the dish and not tasting the flavor of the seafood if I add cheese.  I understand and maybe its offending to the chef but the fact that the waiter kept going on about it really killed my appetite after that. And quite frankly, the linguine was really good but it tasted the same with OR without cheese. 

Yes, I will be thinking about the  good food, but the service and unwanted critters discourages me from hosting team luncheons here again.
author: Resa N.

description:
Four words: Awful value, good chef.

Tiramisu (or Tiraimisv as it's written on the menu), is a restaurant in the middle of a tiny, very crowded alleyway full over at least half a dozen other restaurants. There's plenty of outdoor seating and everything is cramped like it always is in San Francisco.  It's about 30 feet away from a dark alleyway along with the 2 homeless people who live there but it's so crowded here, so it's unlikely that you will be the unlucky person to be bothered here.

I came here with my medical department during a convention, and I personally ordered the veal while everyone else ordered the chicken breast or ravioli.  Veal was soft, and slightly salted, very typical  for an Italian restaurant. We all loved our meals, BUT I would like to comment that this is NOT a filling meal.  The chicken breasts that my coworkers ordered were small, and side dishes are not included in the prices on the menu.  (See photo below of the veal.) 

We also ordered the tiramisu and a slice of chocolate pie, both of which were delicious (as almost all desserts are.)

To summarize, the service is pretty slow, the portions are very small, the outdoor seating isn't special, the location sucks, and the lighting is very dim outside, but the food is prepared well. The dimness would be acceptable if the restaurant was designed to be romantic, but the tables outside are designed to seat big crowds, not couples.
author: Andrew H.

description:
What everyone says is true:

- the staff is horrendously rude
- the service is slow
- and the food is somewhere between ok and terrible

All in all, an authentic European dining experience. 

Ordered a $42 steak medium, came out extra well done on half the steak and medium rare on the other half. Better steaks to be had at Denny's.
author: Daniel L.

description:
After a day in Napa, we decided to get food nearby where the limo dropped us off. We knew we were in the heart of the touristy area, but proceeded to dine at Cafe Tiramisu.

Service: We were seated promptly at a table for six, and they were quite busy on a Saturday night, but service was hit or miss. Sometime sit was hard flagging someone down when we needed something. I also had to literally ASK for bread. We waited a good 10 minutes after being seated, but still no bread. The olive tapenade oil that comes with it is delicious, though.

Food: I ordered the salmon which I thought was pretty good. It came with a pumpkin puree and balsamic spinach. My bf ordered the Mezze Rigatoni, which left him unimpressed, especially for the price.

Ambiance: It's located in this cute alleyway, which can be romantic, but it was a bit chilly and there were no heat lamps nearby!

Price: It's SF and you're in a tourist trap. It's expensive for what you get.

Would I return? Probably not, but we needed somewhere to eat after a long day of wine tasting!
author: Leana L.

description:
I have never left 1 star for a restaurant but this needs to be done. Do NOT come to this place.

Came here with a group of 7 and I will list all the negatives from start to end:

1-  Waited at the table 25 minutes before we got water served to us even after asking for water twice.
2- Ordered two bottles of wine ($190 each bottle) they were both the same wine. I bring up the price because one of the wine bottles had gone bad. They didn't have us try the second bottle and I suppose its because they knew it had gone bad. They just automatically poured it in the decanter since I guess they thought it was the same bottle so no need to try it again. Its pretty ridiculous to charge so much for wine and not make sure its being stored correctly.
3- I went up to the manager after waiting OVER and hour to find out why it was taking so long to at least put in our order for food. His response "you haven't even been waiting that long. We are busy. We will get there when we can, relax" I was appalled. I honestly couldn't believe he would speak to a customer that way. They wouldn't even give us bread and we were there for over an hour! Come on! I would have left but there were too many of us on a Saturday night to try and find another restaurant.
4- When I did finally get my meal, the chicken was dry and had no flavor.

All said and done the bill came out to $710 for the experience above. I am still upset and its now Monday.
author: Alexis G.

description: Outstanding octopus salad, fantastic tiramisu. Wonderful ambiance and great service. I'll be back.
author: Kristopher U.

description: So glad we found this hidden place. The rate was delicious, the staff was friendly. Overall a charming spot for a meal.
author: A H.

description:
I am sad to see that there are any negative reviews for this place. Also shocked that I haven't left a review before! Let's fix that. 

This is my favorite place to eat in the city. It is as close to feeling like you're in Europe as you're going to get. The restaurants spill out into the alley and you sit right next to your neighbors. It's lovely and wonderful and comforting. 

When the hub and I come here we always split a bottle of wine - usually a Chianti because it's an easy drink. They bring out bread with olive oil and tapenade (they will also bring butter if you ask for it!) The last two times we have started with the scallops/risotto and the burrata. Both delicious! 

For main dishes, the hub always gets the black peppered pappardelle (he's a man of habit). I usually go for the cioppino or the ravioli. Consistently good. 

And what's a great dinner without dessert? Recommend the tiramisu or the profiteroles. And, they often will bring out complimentary lemoncello after your meal. I actually heard a woman complain about that this last time! I mean, what a rough life to have people bring you something for free. 

There's usually a wait on the weekends for dinner but they take reservations and they'll squeeze you in where they can even without one. They also never rush you to leave which is fabulous. I hate to add to the wait, but you should definitely go.
author: Linds L.

description: I am a fan and will always be so-- started to go here in 1991 when it first opened-- always go back when the occasion fits-- Opera or a Play-- museum or the local culture icons.
author: Paulie P.

description:
Excellent food, and attentive service.  Isn't that all we want!?  This is the place to get it!
The Octopus appetizer cooked to perfection,  the Short Rib,  the Skirt Steak, and the Ravioli...  not a miss in the bunch.

Our waiter, and the bus men, were attentive, but not hovering!  The wine list has a good variety of by-the-glass selections, and the full bar is there for those in need.  Oh yeah, and for dessert,  great Tiramisu!
author: James G.

description:
Give this 4 1/2 stars. Really enjoyed meal, great waiter.
Details: I had a meeting with my financial adviser. After more than 10 years we've become friends as well so he took me to dinner, corporate account, best of all.
We split a salad & bruschetta. He got salmon and I got the seafood special, halibut.
Bruschetta was OK, not special. Salad really good with beets, apples, nuts. Very fresh. My fish was spectacularly good. A light crust, perfectly cooked. Just enough seasoning to enhance but not drown flavor. It came garnished with large shrimp and tiny mussels; I got an extra tiny fork to get the mussels out of their shells. A sprinkling of peas and a fabulous sauce. On a bed of squid ink risotto. My first try of squid ink. I thought it might taste strong but it's actually quite mild, what I'd call an ocean flavor. Probably more drama than anything. 
Also liked the bread with dipping/drizzling sauce - chimichurri? 
In the midst of our meal, a group of women sat at the next table, really a continuation as there was a long bench, several of them wearing VERY STRONG perfume. I am severely fragrance sensitive and knew at once I had to move as I immediately got a massive headache. If I did not get out of there I would be painfully ill, too nauseated to eat, and all food would taste like perfume anyway. We moved outside, although it was a bit cold. (People on the East Coast might disagree.) The waiter kindly carried out plates, wine glasses, bread, water, etc. We were able to finish & enjoy our meals. 
I asked the waiter (large white male) what the sauce was on the fish, he said lobster. No wonder it was so good!
I wonder of those women were able to taste their food?
Dessert: I got cannoli and he got baba. The cannoli were excellent, they nailed the pastry. I have suffered through soggy pastry too many times! Creamy filling with chunks of chocolate, sprinkled with pistachio. We traded bites. The baba had a good fruity sauce but I think the cake was a tad dry.
So lose 1/2 star for cake, also because prix fixe menu on web site but they had discontinued it. Need to update web site to say so.
author: Carol S.

description:
Spoke with Ivalina regarding a company party for 50 people. I work for a company with successful San Francisco surgeons so I wanted to make sure the party I plan for my company will be perfect. I had a few questions for the restaurant just to make sure they can accommodate 50 people. Ivalina did not like my questions because she said she really didn't know so she hung up on me!

I called back and she gave me this number to call. When I called it, a lady answered and said I had the wrong number. 

I had no budget for the company party I was planning. The hostess, Ivalina just lost 50 customers that make a lot of money. I honestly feel bad for the owner for hiring someone who is so uneducated about the restaurant. New hostess or not, she had bad etiquette.
author: Darlene M.

description:
Business lunch and the place was packed on a Friday.  Quickly seated with a reservation.  Waiter / Manager / Owner? took our orders on memory and got everything right.  He is on top of his game.

Had the Prix Fixe Lunch for $25.. Short Rib Orechiette, Hangar Steak with Asparagus, Fries, Chocolate Gelato.   Great deal and prompt professional service.  Perfect place for a quality and quick business lunch with atmosphere.
author: Scott L.

description:
We were disappointed in our server. We looked at the menu and asked him if there were any specials. He said only what is on the menu.  As we were paying our bill, the same waiter was telling the other table about all of the specials, which sounded great. We would have ordered one of them since our food was only fair. 
We felt short changed. Will not go back there. We spent almost 100.00 but felt like we did not belong there. Not good service. The Hyatt Regency recommended it. We will be letting them know not to make that recommendation anymore
author: Linda S.

description:
We'll start with the positive. Our appetizers, the cheese board and bread with olive oil-basil dipping sauce, were great. Wine, appetizers and entrees were all timed perfectly. In spite of having a large group, all entrees came out at the same time - which is pretty impressive. 
Unfortunately, in terms of the main dishes, I've definitely had much better Italian food elsewhere. I ordered the gorgonzola gnocchi and my dining companion ordered the ravioli. Both were pretty bland and unremarkable. The gnocchi in particular was underwhelming. Overlooked and more like mushy paste balls than the al dente gnocchi I've experienced at other establishments, it came served with a bland cream sauce topped randomly, with sliced almonds. I ended up adding some of the basil olive oil dip that was still on the table from the appetizer bread, which livened it up a tad and made it more palatable. Dessert, panna cotta, was just alright, served with a rather jarring pairing of caramel sauce on one side and strawberries in strong balsamic vinegar on the other. 
Overall, just an okay experience. I'll try somewhere else for Italian food next time.
author: Hilary G.

description: Well,  wine list with none of the wines on the list available.  Bruschetta with jelly not tomatoes, a sweet jelly, not savory.  Waiter attempted to be of service by continuing to bring the wine list back for review but no wines on the list, but he's got a really good white and red.  Broken glasses no help cleaning up.  Food was basically flavorless and bland.  Go to any other restaurant on the block and food and service have to be better.
author: Brandi T.

description: The food is delicious, authentic Italian and always fresh. Also great service and wine selection.
author: Lucy T.

description: Always have a solid meal here. Service great. It's not Five star but good service. Food quality excellent.  Grilled octopus fantastic, pork chops great and the pasta just great. Noisy but it's an Italian cafe.
author: Stewart H.

description:
With a name like Cafe Tiramisu, they better have kick a$$ tiramisu, right?  Well, darn straight, yes they do!!  

Dine about town brought us into Belden Street.  This street comes directly from Europe where patrons dine out on the streets under a year-round twinkling white Christmas lights.  It's quite magical.  It's quite touristy.  It's quite European touristy.  It's quite fun and light hearted.

Dine about town Fixed Prixe meal for $35:
1) Baised beef cannoli - this was like a deep fried egg roll stuffed with soft tender beef.  I thought it was too oily.  If I had to do this over again, I would not order this item.  I would choose a salad instead.
2) 3 meat bolonese sauce pasta - yummy and delicious.  I couldn't finish it and the next day, it tasted even better!  
3) Tiramisu with fresh berries - excellent!  full of room, light, fluffy and perfect.  My only complaint...it was a bit too small, wish it was a sliver larger.

The cafe has been around for a while now.  It can use some sprucing up... the decor is outdated and there's a wet smell in the air.  But because they had been established for such a long time, they maintain an humongous and extensive wine list!  it's like 20 pages deep full of various types of wines you can drink.  That's a plus plus!
author: Jenny T.

description:
What a shame. In terms of the food, I kind of expected more from this place.

I came here the other day with coworkers for lunch, and since we had a reservation for the time they opened, we got seated right way. 

I've never had a cioppino before ($25), so for my first time, it was decent! I liked the variety of seafood (scallops, crab meat, mussels, salmon, and others I can't recognize), and the lobster broth it was in was piping hot, with an almost creamy texture that made it suitable to dip a piece of bread in (which I did, as it came with a small piece). I'll have to try this dish at other places (looking at you, Tadich Grill!) before coming to a conclusion, but I liked what I tasted so far. 

On the other hand, one of my coworkers got one of the steak dishes featured on the prix fixe menu, and while she requested medium, she got well done. 

Also, there's quite a bit of room for improvement in terms of service. For one thing, service was slow, and we were the first group to come in! Some of us were also misled by the waiter into believing that soup of the day came complimentary with our entree, which wasn't the case. Although we probably should have asked to confirm that case, it felt a little unethical to just suggest soup without warning us. But I will give the waiter credit for accommodating my request to redo the payment transaction due to my mistake in splitting the bill. I'm not sure if any Asian restaurant would have done the same. 

All in all, my experience here was okay, but I'm not sure if it's worth a return trip any time soon.
author: Viet N.

description: Wonderful food, wine and atmosphere.  My friends and I came here to celebrate a wedding engagement and had a lovely time.  The owner took care of us, made recommendations and allowed us to sample the wine before placing our order.  Great time and wonderful food!
author: Tim W.

description: Perfectly average Italian food with an assortment of salads and sandwiches to choose from as well. The Belden Place restaurants all seem like copy and paste versions of each other - same outdoor seating with different colored table clothes and same fairly nondescript menus. I got the pappardelle with meat sauce, and it was a classic pasta with red sauce kind of dish. The sauce was rather watery, not exceptionally rich or flavorful. A standard pasta meal, not bad but also not very memorable. Not really worth the price, though it is the financial district, to be fair.
author: Hali M.

description:
Came here for restaurant  week  and had the most exquisite time! Ambiance is real nice. Has a real authentic Italian feel. All the waiters are Italian! Got the prix fix meal and it was definitely worth it. 

For appetizers we got the pan seared scallops and the bresola (air dried beef) and both were soooo good! The scallops were flavorful and melt in your mouth and the beef was just filled with flavor. For the main course I got to try the beef short ribs and the pork chops. The short ribs were so tender and the pork chops were just divine. Seriously everything here was great. I got a special dessert sampler and I was in dessert heaven. Highlights were the flourless chocolate cake (usually my fav) and the tiramasu. The creme brulee was different than what I"m used to. Maybe more like a pudding? But still good nonetheless. 

Glad I got to try a  place I probably never would have gone to!
author: Vivian D.

description: Do you want a horrible experience? You've found your place. It was my parents' 50th anniversary. I wanted to surprise them by picking up their bill so I called two days ahead of time to give them my credit card and make sure they took care of them. The next day they called saying I needed to send them my drivers license and copy of the credit card. Not sure why somebody would try to pay for somebody else's dinner on a fraud, but okay I did it. Called to make sure they got it and they said not to worry. Just to make sure I called TWICE the day of and even spoke to their owner, who confirmed. You guess what happened. They failed miserably. No amount of quality could fix this kind of negligence. Some places just don't get that customer service is half of owning a business. This is a prime example of that. Thanks for nothing, Tiramisu. I will be cancelling my card immediately, so don't try anything.
author: Jake A.

description: This was recommended to us and it was a great recommendation.  We made reservations and went as a group of six and had a great time.  The food was delicious.  We were served by the owner (I believe) and he was quite helpful in answering our questions, although a bit curt. We started with the Bruschetta, which was excellent. Moving on to the meal, my husband and I had the Gnocchi and Risotto.  They both were a palates dream. The Gnocchi is the dish they are best known for, at least based on recommendations and reviews. Our entire group was impressed by the food, wine, and desserts.  If ever in San Francisco again I will gladly return to this restauraunt. My apologies to the owner and he will know why.
author: Lisa M.

description: Fantastic Italian food! Grilled octopus was a great appetizer. A few pieces were over cooked but the other pieces were perfect. I ordered the ravioli and  I cleaned my plate that's how good it was. Service was fantastic and the place is a cute little quaint place. Highly recommend for a great Italian meal!
author: Sara D.

description: Would put a 3.5 star if I could. Went there twice with friends. As expected, the portions are pretty small, but the quality isn't bad for a $$ French restaurant. The pan sheared scollop with risotto is definitely my fav. The rice was extremely flavorful and soaked in scollop sauce, and both the flavor and the texture of the scollops are amazing. I also liked their mussels and clams in spicy tomato broth, corn and leek soup topped with chopped spicy shrimp, and risotto with clam and lobster basque sauce. I also remember trying ahi tuna and smoked salmon appetizer, but it isn't as good.
author: Cate L.

description:
This was a holiday team dinner destination.  This place does seem to do a lot of these even though the space was pretty small. There were 12 of us - but another company had the entire downstairs 3-4 large tables and maybe 30-40 people.

We had a long table and it was hard to hear anyone other than those directly across or next to you.  Bread was served and would have been great warm, but was elevated by a lovey green olive/olive oil tapenade sort of dipping sauce.

There were four appetizers served "family style" (not sure if they were pre-ordered by the organizer of the dinner or what - but sadly 3 of the 4 of them served were fish - so I did not partake (as I recall 3 of them: octopus, ahi tuna and grapefruit, a bruschetta + one more I don't remember).

I ordered the veal Scaloppini with a parmesan risotto. I probably eat veal 2x a year because I kinda feel bad about it, but this little cow did not give his life in vain - it was darn-tooting tasty and tender.  The risotto was also good and there was a bit of spinach on the plate as well to make me feel a teeny bit less guilty.

I doubt I would go there on my own just b/c I hate the way all the Belden Alley hostess try and talk you into going there whenever you walk by, it just feels like the cheesy parts of Paris and Rome where they try and lure the tourists...but if I was trying to figure out a place to get 20 co-workers to dinner I might consider it.

Oh and there is no bar - so if you get there before everyone else you can either wait at the table and look like a loser, or wait outside (and look like a loser).
author: Amy W.

description: Braised short beef was perfectly cooked and delicious, the cannoli and tiramisu were also both delicious!! Not too crowded and customer service was great as well - definitely would come back!
author: Helen W.

description:
Fabulous atmosphere with the restaurant being located in the alley, cushioned right in between other restaurants and having glowing lights hung around the exterior of this place!  Sounds dreamy?  Indeed, it is!

D E C O R - The decor of this place has a Roman touch to it and romantic dining arrangements!  Dine outdoors when the weather forbids!

S E R V I C E - You will be assisted by a hostess upfront and be served by attentive waiters and waitresses throughout your meal courses!

I T A L I A N  F O O D - I loved every dish I tried!  What I HIGHLY RECOMMEND as an opening appetizer is to customize your order by combining their MUSSELS AND CLAMS together in spicy tomato broth!  Having the scrumptious spicy tomato broth to compliment the mussels and clams, the three way combo was tantalizing to my taste buds!!  It was super delicious and when everyone finished eating the mussels and clams, I drank the remaining spicy tomato broth! YUM!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ

O R D E R E D  D I S H E S - 
BRUSCHETTA - Crunchy bread.  Topped with crab meat and diced up, marinated in olive oil, tomatoes, the bruschetta was good.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#UUPXZyoqurkXUkYf9syCeQ

ROASTED SADDLE OF LAMB - The most expensive dish on the menu!  Splurged, but it was surely worth every bite!  The balsamic vinegar with the sage spice flavored around and on the nicely cooked lamb meat, was incredible!

NEW YORK STEAK - Tender and cooked exactly on point!  They could improve on those stringy, thin fries that were topped on the steak, however.  The fries lacked volume and specialty. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#zoTqIB5KPnTdv-amZVrMgA

SEAFOOD MIXED GRILL - The name of the entree is misleading.  The seafood is just salmon!  I like the presentation of this dish - not only was it artsy, but it looked fun!  The capers went well with the salmon!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#9cePDws2M2RgWJCnW_GAXg

VEAL SCALOPPINI - The white wine sauce complimented the mushrooms and veal very nicely.  I love the creamy risotto that was provided with the meal!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#dOPKUbjX08TXy4uDVVZANQ

DESSERT SAMPLERS - There is always room for dessert after a grand meal!  DO GET their dessert samplers because it is basically all the Italian desserts they offer that is combined into petite, delectable portions!  I enjoyed the display and a mini bite of each dessert!  I assumed that their tiramisu will be the best of all the desserts just because the restaurant is named Cafe Tiramisu.  It was not the best tiramisu I have ever had and not the best of all the desserts they provided.  My most favorite dessert, was their ice cream with a cup that was made out of hardened caramel!  It was unique, refreshing and savory!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-tiramisu-san-francisco?select=fQbdgIeO06iAgTbUfZ8QdQ#nOkzDCEROTQTtEcDeZrRYA

F I N A L  S A Y - A great, low-key restaurant if you are wanting to shy away from the crowd and to enjoy a hint of Italian charm!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Visited here for a late night dinner after touring San Francisco and it was a pleasant dinner.  We had a wonderful waiter who was on top of everything!

I was only eating small plates because of the hour.  I ordered the scallops appetizer served over a butternut squash and risotto and a side of spinach florentine.  The spinach was wonderful served with raisins and onions....superb.  The scallops were good however my expectations were that the sauce would have a sweeter taste with the butternut squash sauce but I really could not taste the squash at all.  They were still delicious!

My son who is so picky at 13 could not find anything that he wanted to eat, but my hubby and the waiter were able to create a spaghetti and veal meatball dish, that he loved!

Hubby had the short rib ravioli, he liked it but said he would not order it again, just something about the taste.

It is located in the financial district in this cool alley with other restaurants.  They featured outside seating but we chose to eat inside.  The place has a great authentic Italian feel, and I cannot say enough about our waiter and his service.

The only thing minor thing I would add is the menu was kind of limited in choices.  I definitely would go back to try some other dishes.
author: Lori M.

description:
Terrible!!! A run down and old restaurant . The older man on the door (possibly the owner) was rude and dismissive. Was no help when my girlfriend asked for recommended veggie options. Just said 'I dunno, what do you like' 
The food was terrible too, tasteless gnocchi and even the couple next to us complained about the Sea Bass, which looked pretty bad! The same older man that served us just shrugged his shoulders and said 'it's the only fish on the menu so that's it' then walk off. Stay away, would not recommend.
author: Ami S.

description:
Love it! I try and get there every couple weeks.
Service is great, very efficient.
Get the mussels
author: Jeffrey N.

description:
After a friend's birthday party of Napa wine tasting, we came back to The City looking for somewhere to eat dinner. Café Tiramisu ended up being that place.

We were seated outside in their lit alleyway patio, heated. The decor was reminiscent of Ancient Rome, especially if you entered the restaurant to go downstairs to the restroom -- all of the walls and murals looked exactly like that.

On with the food! I ordered:

-Grilled Octopus: over avocado, celery and salmoriglio sauce
-Petrale Sole Dore Picatta: with jalapeño, prawns and green pea risotto

Shared the octopus with several people. Was very complacent with it -- soft texture on this dish means everything. When my main dish with Petrale Sole arrived, it was fantastic, savory with decent spicy flair.

While a tad touristy (again, the "Roman" walls...), the service and food were both great. Those two elements alone would bring me back. Not even going to mention our dessert!
author: Garett T.

description:
We had a wonderful dinner and bottle of wine here before heading to the ATT center to see AC/DC in concert. (Which was amazing by the way.

I found the owner (I think) to be abrupt and a bit impatient. It could have been completely wonderful had the service been better. It felt like herding people and shuffling tables. 

Other than that our appetizers and meal were great. Loved the out door seating.
author: Suzy C.

description:
Sauce didn't taste fresh on my pasta dish. However, the dessert (tiramisu, of course) was great

Service was very slow, but when the waiter did come by, he was very anxious as if he was in a rush or wanted us to get out.
author: Lindsay E.

description:
OMG! This is hands down the best Italian place I've ever been too! My friends and I arrived early for dinner on Friday night. We were seated right away. The servers were friendly, knowledgable ...and cute ;) 
I ordered the bruschetta and the prosciutto and mozzarella salad. The bruschetta was fantastic. The bread used was soft yet still crispy. Topped with cherry tomatoes, burrata, arugula and drizzled with arugula oil. Best bruschetta ever!

Then we ordered the dessert sampler. Usually they charge $10 per person but they only charged us for 2 people (3 people altogether) which was very kind of them. We got to try the tiramisu, panna cotta, cream puff and the ice cream to name a few. 

Great job! I never thought I would ever find an italian restaurant that would blow my mind but this place definitely did the job. Thank you! I will without a doubt come back again.
author: Jeanie Ann D.

description:
One of the best veal plates I've ever had. So tender and juicy. I must go back soon!

Tiramisu on point by scale of 1-10, 10 being the shit.
Melt in your mouth, waiter bring me another plate, and how bout pack some to go as well. Yes that good, in my confident opinion.

Waiter Tony and owner Giseppe are both very attentive and awesome. Really feels like an Italian home. You must eat more and no you can't leave without getting dessert. This is in no way to make their pockets fuller, but literally we know our food is good and seriously you need to eat. You know how Italians roll.

Everything made to perfection. Wine selection is also on point.
author: Myhanh B.

description:
Our group had our latest monthly dinner club at Cafe Tiramisu.  We've collectively been to a lot of places along Belden Place but none of us recalled eating here before.  We had a good experience and were surprised how inexpensive the meal was after all the wine and food we ordered.  

We started off with the bruschetta, veal meatballs, ravioli all which were tasty.  For the main meal I ordered the rack of lamb which was suggested by our waiter.  I thought it was done perfectly and the meatballs on the side were great too. I forgot what we had for dessert but I know that it was licked clean.

The food wasn't too different than other places along Belden Place but it was a great value.
author: Blake B.

description: By far the best Italian we have had since Italy. The tagliatelle, which is their signature dish, was amazing. Any of their risottos are to die for, and their scallops are perfect. Buffalo mozzarella was as if it was made moments prior to serving. But the best part is the ambiance and service. We truly felt as if we were being courted by the entire staff. One of the best dining experiences we have had in San Francisco in years. Bravo! Oh, and definitely get the tiramisu!
author: Brett L.

description:
We had a great experience here. The service was fast yet professional, the food was fresh and seasonal, and the ambiance was so romantic - I felt like we were in Italy at a little outdoor cafe. 

We shared the pear, arugula and radicchio salad, the grilled prawns with fennel, blood oranges, and avocado and the rigatoni. Everything was delicious.
author: Sarah W.

description:
We loved this restaurant and are going back again tonight!  My mom says the gnocchi is the best she ever had!  

The bread and olive tapenade oil is DELICIOUS - if you love olives!  

The owner was walking around making sure all were happy. It was a beautiful night and we sat outside. This place is in with 6 others restaurants all side by side. 

We ate at Plough the night before but were happier with this place!  

We split the scallop appetizer over risotto and that is what I'm getting for my dinner tonight along with a salad. Double yum!

No drinks or dessert for us. I got the farfalle pasta with bolognese. Good but I want the scallops all to myself tonight.
author: Becky A.

description:
We decided to have dinner here for NYE. Small cozy place. We had reservations for 5:30. It was too busy, like only 4 other tables were taken near us. They had inside and outside seating but it was kind of cold for us to be sitting outside. 

We started out with a glass of prosecco each for $10. Yum. Complimentary bread was cold, but i guess that is how they want us to eat it. The oil dip was 

Food:
Risotto with shrimps ($21) was pretty good. First time having risotto. It was creamy and it was hot pretty much the whole time I was eating. 

Braised pork ravioli ($19 ) was tender and really flavorful. A lot of cheese and creamy sauce. 

Kind of expensive, but good portion for me. Music was playing in the background and it wasn't too loud with the people around us.

Service was fine. Pretty attentive to us. Our waiter even put our napkins on our lap for us. He refilled our water, asked us if our food was good, and if we wanted more prosecco.
author: Crystal H.

description:
This restaurant was featured on Check Please! so I was instantly curious, so when a friend wanted to catch up and asked for suggestions for places to go for dinner, this place came to mind!  

It is located in the bustling alleyway of Belden Place, and Cafe Tiramisu looks established and has a good regular following of customers.  

We loved our meal and we enjoyed catching up here!  We shared an appetizer of tuna tartare which was perfectly prepared and was really tasty.  Next, we shared a beet salad wth burrata - this was fresh and refreshing to the palate -- I would definitely order this again!  

I felt like having ravioli for dinner so the lobster ravioli caught my eye on the menu.  It was a gorgeously presented, the flavors meled together perfectly and the housemade pasta was tender -- I was thoroughly impressed!  And of course, we needed to order tiramisu even though we were already completely full - the tiramisu was so creamy, chocolate-y and dreamy.  I would recommend this to everyone as the flavors were absolutely amazing!  

Service was nice, friendly and attentive.  The only thing is my friend was sitting on the aisle and she kept getting nudged or lightly knocked when people walked by - perhaps something could be done about that.  Other than that, our dining experience was wonderful, and I cannot wait to come back for a tasty Italian meal!
author: Maile N.

description:
Best Italian restaurant in SF. 

Every single dish is delicious, the owner is very friendly. 

Very recommended.
author: Alberto M.

description: We were greeted by the owner and were unable to sit outside due to the time of the day we showed up and no reservations.  One of us had the linguine and clams and the other had the cioppino. Both were very good and reasonably priced. Our waiter who was also the owner showed us every item as it came out from the kitchen where we could see what it looked like before we ordered.  You must save room for the tiramisu as it is probably some of the best I've ever had.  I would definitely go back.
author: Cara S.

description:
This place deserves 4 stars.

The food is really good, the menu is on-point. The atmosphere, at night, is charming, out of a story book, with the hanging lights outside on the patio.

We were all happy with the dishes we ordered.  The service was good, even though they were at capacity.

We will DEFINITELY be back to explore the menu.
author: Darien R.

description: Had an early dinner-6:30 and seated comfortably by choice outside on a damp December night near the heater. Great wine list-a white from Alto Agio and a red from Umbria. Shared some grilled octopus with avocado-outstanding. Wife and her girlfriend had salmon and seabass. Good portion and cooked expertly. I had one of the best New York steaks, other than what I make at home, I've had in a restaurant. Service was keen with that elusive mix of care but not hovering- real pros. Enjoy some good wine and relax at Tiramisu. Put your damn cell phones down and enjoy your company with conversation, not texting.  Also don't wear baseball caps in a dinner house. Had a Tony Soprano moment "educating" a fellow patron to remove his hat. The Bay Area is chock full of men who were never taught manners as     small boys.
author: Michael S.

description: Dinner was very good with just a few exceptions. The waiter was not real attentive. For example, there is a table of five guys and he brings one basket of bread with four slices?? Never came back, never asked if we wanted any additional bread and we are eating mostly pasta type dishes. In fact, I think he was trying to do as little as possible which he achieved an A plus. Food quality was very good just disappointing the service was mediocre at best.
author: Rigo D.

description: There was a big piece of piece of plastic in my pappardelle. Yea, won't be coming back.
author: Q C.

description: A lot of people are complaining about the service but we had a pretty good experience here. Came here for lunch last week and we were a group of about 10. We were seated pretty quickly, got our complimentary bread (which was cold and dry) and didn't have to wait too long to order. I had the shellfish linguini and it was phenomenal!! I would highly recommend it. Most of my co-workers got the ravioli and risotto and they were all pretty happy with the entrees. We didn't have any appetizers or desserts but the entrees were delicious and I'd definitely be back.
author: Varun K.

description: Very unkind. I went there few times and their foods are good overall but the old guy, I don't know he is manager or owner, he was not nice at all. On that day, Me and my friend ordered soda and it smells tap water strongly and I told them this soda tastes tap water strongly. And he said it taste nothing wrong and told other people, me and my friends are new generation and was laughing at us. It was worst experience ever in San Francisco.
author: Sujeong B.

description: This is a great little Italian joint in that restaurant alley off Bush St. Very good food, and not too expensive compared to some of the high end places there. The squid ink pasta is fantastic, and so are the mussels. The dessert sampler is huge!
author: Peter K.

description: Hate this format. Tried to write my 1st review twice but forced to cancel. Had to find "review" & was too frustrated by then. Highly recommend this restaurant. Blame Yelp that I don't tell u why. F...k Yelp!
author: Sylvia G.

description:
This place is hidden in an alley but don't fear and it is well worth it!!! The venue is very small but we didn't have to wait. We came here after work pretty late one evening and were seated immediately. 

We shared some Bruschetta which is the best I've ever had and I eat a lot of bruschetta. I ordered Sole for my main dish and it was buttery and awesome. I inhaled it all. 

I highly recommend this restaurant. I wasn't impressed by very many restaurants in San Fran but I was with this one!
author: Anita C.

description: I'm a big fan of their penne arrabbiata.  It has the perfect level of spice and a good earthy flavor from the mushrooms to compliment the goat cheese and tomato sauce.  One of those dishes I always use my bread to wipe the plate clean of sauce when i am done with the pasta. :)  Just warms the soul.  I enjoy the environment; nice calm atmosphere with friendly staff.  Reminds me of being back in Chicago with my Italian uncles.  Alla prossima...
author: Rebecca R.

description:
My buddy is a regular here and the staff always treats him well, so I went with him last time I was here.

The squid ink noodles and the mussels were nice.

It's a fun place in the early evening when the alley is full and there's that bustling city vibe going on.  In the later evening it has a fairly different character.  

There's plenty of space to stretch out if you go late, and that makes things a bit more relaxed.

I feel like I come here more for the evening out kind of atmosphere than for the dining experience though.  

With that in mind, you have to make sure you don't have too much fun, however, because that's when you wake up with a headache and a strange, foggy memory of what just went down, wondering where your phone fell out of your pocket.

Some places are just like that.
author: Gopal R.

description:
My family and I went to check this place out for a quick dinner on recommendation by the Ritz Carlton concierge. The restaurant name was tucked behind a row of umbrellas so it was a tad bit hard to find.

We were greeted by a friendly hostess who seated us outside right below the heater. A server came out and recommended that we order the pappardelle and the cioppino so we did just that...plus carpaccio! After ordering, a couple servers came out and started placing our utensils down for us. A basket of bread and a cup of olive oil was also brought out. The olive oil was enjoyable, heh.

All 3 of our dishes came out at the same time but I'll start with the carpaccio. It doesn't look like your standard carpaccio, most likely due to the black pepper. It looked like lightly seared, rare beef. It was topped with arugula, fennel, artichoke and Parmesan and dressed in a vinaigrette. It didn't really appeal to my taste. The beef wasn't as flavorful as I hoped it would be and the vinaigrette really didn't too good of a job complementing the beef. 

The pappardelle was the dish I personally ordered so I was hoping it'd be rocking. The server said that the pasta was house made so I appreciated that. The dish honestly looked like flopped lasagna, which I don't really mind, but it tasted just okay. The bolognese sauce was pretty standard.

The cioppino was probably the dish that I enjoyed the most but like the pappardelle, it was just okay. My mom actually said that it was worse than something similar she had at The Fish Market. It's not that it was bad...it's just that it could have been better. 

The service was above average though! The waiters were always checking up on us to see if we needed anything. They happily brought us out more bread and olive oil when we finished the first batch. 

Quite honestly, had the prices been lower, this place would have earned another star. However, the ratio of taste to price really just didn't work out. It's on the expensive side for what you're getting. Go here if you want but don't expect this place to land a spot on your top Italian places to go to.
author: Joseph L.

description: such a great little gem located in Belden Place! the service is great and fast, and the workers here are always eager to answer any questions. food is delicious and simple. must try their spagetti ink pasta and definitely end the night with their tiramisu! so decadent and rich.
author: Ava F.

description: Horrible service! Well after the dinner hour, theyrefused to serve just dessert and coffee despite plenty of empty tables. Would never go back.
author: Natalie W.

description:
Cozy, comfortable atmosphere, but enough tables to accommodate larger parties. Came here with10 people for a business dinner and everyone was very happy with their food.

Everything was delicious: nicely cooked, well-seasoned, classic flavors. Nothing groundbreaking, but very solid, upscale, traditional Italian.
author: Scott W.

description:
Don't listen to the majority here - the food, the service, everything was bad. 

I had wished that after I tried the minestrone soup that I had cancelled the rest of the order. I had the thought while eating my entree - what is this? This is not good food. This is sludge.
author: Jenn D.

description:
The food was OK - the rigatoni with meat sauce was pretty good but the chicken with marsala sauce just tasted off somehow.

The service wasn't that great either. The place was half empty but it was tough to get ahold of a waiter and the service was just slow and not that friendly.
author: Sophie B.

description: If you want the best short rib here is where to find it. Falls apart with every bite you take and the mash potatoes are just as good. Service was excellent and the food is worth way more than the price!! Eat here.
author: Chris J.

description:
Great food, amazing ambiance, cozy and intimate italian atmosphere, perfect service!
Charming decor and great food.
We had squid ink linguini pasta and it was absolutely fresh and tasty!
We will surely come back
author: Mirelle C.

description:
This is the second time I have been here - how could I have not reviewed this place before??  I must be getting old.

Anyway, this was a picture perfect night.  Why??  Well, it might have to do with my childhood of being around a bunch of people during the holidays and being outside in inclement weather.
