This night, we were with our kids, one of my kid's friends and our two friends from Oregon.  We were going to just stay home and have homemade spaghetti sauce and some garlic bread - I am sure glad we decided to come into the city!!!

We parked at Union Square garage, went by Macy's and saw the kitties and pups, saw the tree in the square and then went to Chinatown for some bargain xmas shopping - my kids idea.  All the while, the rain was coming down in buckets.  After a few stops in Chinatown, we decided to get a snack, but, decided otherwise since everyone wanted more than a bite.  I remembered Cafe Tiramisu from another celebration, so, off we went from Chinatown.

The place is located in Belden alley, which in my mind, is a perfect little getaway.  The scene couldn't have been more perfect.... walking down Bush street, jumping over huge puddles, me yelling out to the crowd through the rain buckets "take a left, it's down that alley.  The bright neon sign above the door showed us the way to our perfect destination.

Every dish that was ordered was consumed in record time, not because we were overly ravenous, rather, because with each bite you wanted more!!

I had the Caesar and the short ribs.  The Caesar was good, nothing extraordinary.  The short rib didn't look like much, just a long piece of meat on a bed of horseradish mashed potatoes with a red/brown sauce.  But the taste.....it was veryyyyy good, succulent meat - didn't even need to chew it, it was that tender.  The sauce was also perfect.  I also had a Manhattan and a glass of Cab - both accompanied my meal perfectly.

We all ordered dessert, because, well.... our other choice was to leave and go into a major downpour.  So, we stayed, had cappuccinos and some sweets.  The profiteroles were amazing, the tiramisu was off the charts, I had the sugar and cinnamon coated doughnuts filled with italian custard.   OH  MY EFFIN GOD - THESE WERE AMAZING!!!  Maybe one of the top 5 desserts I ever had - that good.

We were the last in the restaurant, the manager gave us some comp'd lemoncello's. We got to talking to him and the next thing you know, it's 10:15!!!  (we got there at 7:30!!!).  So we bid Tiramisu a fond farewell and went out into the night.

But.... our night wasn't done yet!!!  We walked over to the B of A building (in light rain) to see that tree - it is much nicer than the Union Square tree, imo.  After a photo shoot around the tree, I came up with the idea to walk down to the Hyatt Regency to see their Christmas display.  It was nice, it was warm, it was dry.  After a few trips up and down the elevators (and finding the on/off switch for the lobby xmas tree on the 14th floor and messing with that, hehe) we settled into the Hyatt bar for a drink.

All in all, just a perfect evening with wonderful companions on a picture-perfect night (for me).  This night, not only thanks to Tiramisu, will go down in the annals as one of my fav holiday season visits to the city.  It was just that good.  Sometimes a perfect storm can be quite positive, and in this case, truer words could not be uttered. 

Ya feel me??
author: Johnny L.

description:
We came during the SF Restaurants Week. At the beginning, the hostess tried to seat us at the basement. Gosh! It smelled so bad down there. So, when you make a reservation, make sure you tell them not to seat you in the basement. 

We had the $25 pre-set menu. 

Salad: Just OK
Soup: Good
Fish with spicy shrimp risotto: It tasted like the fish you got from Costco frozen section. 
Black Pepper Hanger Steak: Gosh! It was a bomb. The steak was so juicy and tender. 
Gelato: I love the presentation. It was good too.
author: J L.

description:
I came here for Dine About Town with my boyfriend and another couple. 

First impression: It is tucked in a lit alley with other restaurants. It would be nice to sit outside if it wasn't so cold. They have heat lamps but they're not all around. 

On the DAT menu, which has a very nice selection, I ordered the appetizer: Hand Made Orecchiette with duck ragu & fresh ricotta, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, entree: Dungeness Crab Angolotti with mascarpone vodka sauce, dessert: Piccolo Tiramisu Lady finger cookies, mascarpone, espresso. My boyfriend ordered soup: Cauliflower with Dungeness Crab, Black Pepper Beef Carpaccio with arugula, shaved fennel, raw artichoke & shaved parmesan, appetizer: Grilled Butcher Steak over creamy portabella mushrooms, red wine & parmesan shoestring fries.

My favorite had to be the Dungeness Crab angolotti! I could've ordered another 2 orders! It is basically a dungeness crab ravioli with more dungeness crab on time. I will go back just for that!
Everything else was very delicious! No complaints!

The service was very good as well. Our server was very patient, since we were still waiting for my boyfriend to arrive. He was 30mins late. We were able to sit down at our table without having to wait for the entire party to arrive like other restaurants, which is a good thing since it was cold outside! We took our time and didn't feel rushed at all.

I would definitely come back for the food!
author: Jean T.

description:
I was really impressed with the charm and quaint location of this restaurant.  The location of the restaurant is situated inside a small alley flanked by other charming restaurants.  Unfortunately, that's where the positive remarks stop.   

There were 6 of us for dinner, so I was able to taste over 8 dishes.  None of them really made great impression on me as nothing was special.  I will say again, the food was mediocre through and through.

We ordered a few appetizers to wet our palettes- the prosciutto was dried out on one edge. The cheese and bread were dry and hard as well.  

I ordered the gnocchi for the main course and found to my dismay how super-saturated the gnocchis were.

I really wanted to like the food.  I really tried.  :(.
author: daniel k.

description:
I think we all know of a place that used to be good, but no longer lives up to our memories - unfortunately, Cafe Tiramisu is such a place. It used to be a good place for Italian downtown, but the owner and his once celebrated staff are now tired and cranky. 

Last night I was in the area and since I hadn't been to Cafe Tiramisu in several years and was craving Italian, I decided to stop in with my wife to see if they had a table. Yes, it's the busy holiday season and no, we didn't have a reservation, but we thought we would give it a try anyway. Immediately upon walking in, a waiter (heavy-set guy who has been there for years) walked our way and asked if we had a reservation. When we said "no," he responded, "We're full, try the place on the corner, they have similar food, unless you want to wait 20 minutes." No greeting, no niceties, no smile, just a shrug off and then he walked away. No exaggeration. We stood there for a spilt-second and then the owner walked up and the exact same interaction followed. Wow! We again looked at each other and I said, "I don't feel good about this place anymore." The owner overheard me and then said, "Well, you should've stayed home." Wow! The place wasn't packed and we would've gladly waited 20 minutes if we were at least treated cordially. Sad. As a small business owner myself, it's sad to see a fellow small business owner and his staff treat prospective customers with such disregard. We all have bad nights, but somehow, I got the sense that this sort of thing happens often at Cafe Tiramisu. Sad. Very sad.
author: Rocky B.

description:
Oh, where to start. 

I should have realized there'd be trouble when the overpowering smell of lamp oil dominated the room.  

Was it when I couldn't hear my dinner companion from across the table, the presentation of the ciabatta rolls that looked and tasted straight out of the package, a bruschetta that was an explosion of unrecognizable tastes that could only be described as a mass of wet brightness, or the rectangular plate of undersized the lukewarm meatballs that soon followed?

And this was before the entrees were served. But to stop right here and well, never come back.
author: Garrett K.

description:
In actuality, I give this place a 3.3-3.5, but yelp doesn't accommodate shades of grey!! :)

Anywho, I discovered Belden place when my best friend and I decided to have dinner in the city to catch up. We were both in the mood for pasta, so after walking up and down the street, we chose Cafe Tiramisu. 

I am happy with our decision and would go again and also recommend this place to my friends. Although I work in North Beach where italian is king, this place held its own. 

We ordered the calamari, spaghetti with crab, and mushroom risotto, all to share. When the calimari came out it did not look like your usual fried calamari, we were super confused. But then we ate it. Wow! This was the best calamari I have ever had. It felt lighter since it was not fried but was bursting with flavor. The plate included potatoes and thinly sliced cucumbers and a vinaigrette drizzle, my mouth is literally watering thinking about it. Please do yourself a favor and order this. 

The spaghetti with crab with good, not great. The spaghetti was nice and light, not overly sauced at all. But didn't have the kick of flavor I wanted. The crab was also good. I think if these are the flavors you are in the mood for, it is a tasty dish. Note on the service here -  our waiter was awesome. Very friendly and attentive but not overbearing. We asked him to please break the crab for us (don't judge me) and he graciously did so with a laugh. 

The mushroom risotto with ahi tuna was heaven on a plate. We both said "mmm" on first bite. I never choose risotto over pasta, but I am so glad we did here. For all your mushroom lovers, this will hit the spot. The ahi tuna was also wonderful and went really well with the rest of the ingredients. 

All and all, I am looking forward to trying this place again. I did not check out the inside or the bar. The outside isn't the prettiest/fanciest but it was nice nonetheless. The whole vibe of Belden Place made it a really cute dinner spot.
author: Zahra K.

description: A busy restaurant on Belden Lane on Wednesday evening. Both the food and service were very good. The Grilled Octopus appetizer was tender and quite tasty. I had the Sea Bass entree, it was well prepared and fresh. I skipped the desserts on offer, the remainder of our party cleaned them up.
author: Richard P.

description: No words. This is so so good!! Best meal of our entire trip! And our waiter (restaurant manager) is awesome!! Just delicious
author: Wendy S.

description:
Went to celebrate a birthday and had an ok time.

Service was a little cold but efficient. Couldn't get a smile from our server all night. Our party sat down and took a while for us to even get menus. 

Entrees were good but nothing spectacular. Tiramisu was delicious! Dont really plan on returning anytime soon. 

One plus was they had the Giants game playing!
author: Gina S.

description:
If I could give it zero stars...it would be a starting point.

Arrived to the waiter wanting to seat us just outside the door.  Over which one chair leg was perched on a drain cover... The open kind with a few bars across.

Long story short, cocktails didn't taste right (Vodka & Tonic.. Maybe flat)), didn't have the wine we wanted on the list that we ordered, so came with comparable, Cain Cuvée 2003, they couldn't get the cork out of. The waiter disappeared  with the bottle for five minutes, the  came back with it in a decanter... Warning bells!!!  Said the cork was rotten...  We mentioned that we were not happy with the wine being opened and poured outside of our sight.  The waiter (a Russian guy, not Italian) said... No problem and poured...

Asked for bread as we were hungry and our neighbors who arrived after us were already served... Hmmm... The bread arrived cold and as if from a costco bulk bag, slightly stale.

We had ordered apps, but the meatballs and octopus arrived stone cold... And by that time I didn't even want to touch the Ahi Tuna Crudo... Visions of the weekend on the toilet were just too much.

Even though we never made it to the main course, they still got 250 dollars out of us for literally nothing. 

Close this pit down.

Got in a cab and went to Park Tavern for some real food....!!
author: Neil S.

description: San Francisco is one of the world leaders in food... We come up from the lower part of the state to enjoy the most inventive consistent trends with food in the City ... But sometimes you just need a place that is familiar. We stopped back in to our favorite hole in the wall place for some solid Italian. We love the clams in tomato broth, the bruschetta, the carpociao, the burrata, just to start... All of them perfect. It reminds me of Italy... Good solid high end ingredients in their simple form. for mains Also had the sole with crab and jalepeno risotto... Solid... and maple glazed Pork Chop! Man what a meal. Eating here 20 years, finally reviewing it and going to eat here again the next time I'm in the City. Didn't think this should be less than 4 Stars on Yelp and had to give my opinion!
author: Sean J.

description:
Just grabbed a quick lunch here.  I was planning to eat Sushi at Akiko's but there was a 30 minute wait so I walked down to Belden Place and decided to try something new.

I sat inside and ordered some water and a glass of Merlot.   At $14, I would have expected a better quality wine.   I then placed my order and started with a soup followed by the Black Ink Risotto.

The soup was a big fat disappointment and all I could taste was the overpowering flavor of tomato, an ingredient that I don't even recall seeing on the menu.   There was some crab meat thrown in for good measure, so at least they made good on that promise.

The Black Ink Risotto was nicely plated and looked very nice.   The scallops were very well prepared and I was able to cut them very easily with the edge of my fork.   As for the black ink risotto itself... Meh... It was ok.   Then again, I really couldn't ask for too much more considering it was a $12 dish.

I probably need to give these guys another try...  I certainly wasn't blown away with my lunch here, but I think they deserve another shot.   Until then, 3 stars it is.
author: David O.

description:
With very bad service from this new waiter.  The previous italian waiter was much better, this guy was unhappy and just plain rude.
Don't know if this is because the waiter ruin my appetite or the food just plain went bad.  
We told the waiter it was my guest's birthday, and all he did was just put a candle on the dessert which I order.
Will not go back again.  I plan on writing a bad review of this restaurant on every restaurant page
author: Kiki S.

description:
best italian in san francisco
reasonable price, quick service, no too much talking or less, delicious food. im sure i will come back here.
author: Jessica P.

description: Absolutely ridiculously good food! I was expecting not so great tasting food because it has lower reviews than most... Boy was I surprised! Fantastic. A must try!
author: Krys L.

description:
I do not understand how this place is not 5 star rated. We stumbled on this place because another place was full. We were pleasantly blown away from the beginning.

The salads were amazingly seasoned, not too heavy but with great flavor which is what  we'd say about everything else. 

The pastas were amazing and the service was great. I'd come here every time we come to SF.
author: peter l.

description:
i went here for lunch with a coworker. yeah, it's lunchtime in the fi-di. but when we walked up, maybe four of the tables outside were occupied. we had an hour and figured we'd be okay.

it took at least 5 minutes for someone to wander by and offer to get us a drink.

it took another 10 minutes for someone to realize that we hadn't been asked what we want to eat.

there was gnocchi on the menu (it doesn't show on their website menu, but they had it) and it said it came with chopped tomatoes. i'm not a huge fan of tomatoes, so i asked if i could have it without the chopped tomatoes.

the server looked at me like i was crazy. 

"but that's the way the chef makes it. how can you not have tomatoes with your gnocchi? without tomatoes it's just..."

he was so horrified and speechless i said "fine, it's okay, i will just eat around them"

"well i can give you pesto instead"

"oh, okay, pesto it is then"

clearly he didn't understand that i meant no *chopped* tomatoes. of course i want sauce. i didn't say no tomato sauce. but okay, i like pesto better anyway, thanks for making me feel like i'm crazypants.

my coworker orders and we get an appetizer too.

by this time other people had wandered in and sat down, and a group of four guys sat next to us.

they ordered and got their food before our appetizer appeared. they were finished before our main course made it to the table.

i don't know really what else to say. it was like we were somehow invisible even though we were right next to the entrance to the restaurant. 

the food was good; i don't like scallops but the scallops appetizer was very nice. my pesto gnocchi was well executed. 

the food is the only reason this is two stars and not one. 

because of the really awful service though, i doubt i'll ever come back.
author: Cat F.

description:
Lost 9lbs in 2 days. Well, that doesn't sound too bad no?
I eat out on Belden Pl once or twice a week on average and after months I decided to try Cafe Tiramisu to spice things up a little bit. Oh my, what a mistake.

Food tasted delicious but 6 hours later I was in the bathroom at home in agony trying to get rid of a bug I acquired from the food. I know it was from their cioppino because I had only had a plain bagel all day (doubt that had food poisoning). I was very bad for 3 days losing 9lbs in the first two days whilst trying to stay hydrated.

Contacting the restaurant was pretty useless, taking a full 8 days to reply and then dismissing the issue as they said I was the only one to complain, as if food poisoning needs to come from a poisoned pot of food and has no other way to make it to my plate!

Very unprofessional management and I will be following up with the SFDPH so they can make sure the restaurant is up to code with cleanliness.
author: Darren C.

description: I have eaten here 2 times now and both have been wonderful! The food is fresh and delicious and the atmosphere is great as well. I love this place especially for the staff and the owner! They are kind and get the food out in good time!  The location is interesting since it is in a back alley but this allows for a fairly quiet experience since there is not a lot of foot or car traffic that goes by. I would recommend this place over and over. The first time I had Beef Short Ribs and the cheese platter and the second time Veal Scalapini.... Both wonderful! Anyone who gives this place 3 1/2 stars or less doesn't have taste buds.
author: Branden W.

description: This place was INCREDIBLY good. It's just the bomb, plain and simple. I don't understand anything less than a four. We had the snapper, two chess plates, and the outrageously good veal carpaccio. Simply put out of this world. Not cheap. But worth it.
author: Marcos A.

description:
Enter through the alley for the atmosphere. First rate Italian place. White table cloth place with matching waiters. Dynamic place, close quarters, vibrant. The food rocks in all regards.

Great 2nd date place. Great business dinner place to thank the customer for closing the deal.
author: Greg G.

description:
We went here for Dine About Town 2014. We ordered:

Appetizer:
Chestnut and butternut squash soup with truffle oil
Ahi tuna crudo with burrata and sturgeon caviar

Entree:
Salmon filet with crusted with sun dried tomato pinenuts pesto, broccoli and garbanzo fondue
Pork tenderloin crusted with pistachio, goat cheese, blueberry sauce, pancetta wrapped green beans

Dessert:
Three scoops of vanilla and pistachio gelato, raspberry sorbet
Trio of house of desserts (tiramisu, bombolini toscana, warm chocolate cake - they ended up giving us vanilla ice cream instead of the cake and they didn't say anything about the substitution)

Soup was kind of bland, ahi tuna crudo was not bad, salmon was cooked nicely, and goat cheese was a little too strong when paired with the pork.

Overall, the restaurant was alright. The food was nothing special, the restaurant layout was a little awkward with it being hard to navigate to the tables, and service was a little slow. We probably won't be coming back for their regular menu.
author: NoonNarin N.

description: Overpriced mediocrity.  Bartender did not know how to make an old fashioned or Manhattan.  Drinks came in a glass slightly larger than a shot glass for $10. Ahi Tuna was very fishy. Olive dipping sauce was excellent.  Red sauce was good.   Bill was $125 for two people. Would not go again.
author: Mike S.

description: Nice little hideaway near Chinatown.  Bread served with pesto is a plus.  I had the veal scallopini on a bed of spinach with a side of parmesan risotto.  The veal was fork tender and very flavorful - risotto was average.  Overall, an enjoyable meal.
author: Jim M.

description: Way overrated. Food was quite average and uninspired. We saw the ratings and reviews on Check Please. Everyone said such great things about the restaurant and food but we were very disappointed. I should've suspected a problem when I was able to book a reservation for Saturday night at 7pm on the evening prior. The oysters were not fresh and had to be returned. The restaurant was only half full and they didn't open the downstairs tables. I think you get the idea.
author: Dodeskaden L.

description:
D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!
Went there to celebrate my husband's birthday with the in-laws. Sat inside in the narrow hallway. MIL was scared of getting her head hit by the waiters rushing by. We ask to sit somewhere else and the owner(?) told us with a disgusted face "we've been doing this for 20 years don't worry we're not gonna hit you". Sure you can say that but what if we're not comfortable with how close they get? Anyways the food made up for that treatment. 
I wasn't that hungry so I just ordered the grilled calamari. Oh just thinking about it makes my mouth water. It had zucchini, potatoes, olives and squid ink. Soo good, great combination of flavors. Everyone loved their dishes and there wasn't one speck left on the plates.
For dessert I had the limoncello strawberries panna cotta with mango sauce. Delish as well.
I can't wait to go back!
author: Julia F.

description:
One of several restaurants with outdoor dining on Belden Pl., this has authentic Italian ownership and food. Service was very good without being obtrusive and no prompting was required to have glasses refilled and the bread basket topped off.
Oysters, clams and calamari made good starters as did the Caesar salad which they willingly split at no charge. 
Swordfish was tender and moist as was the sole. Ample portions with interesting sides. We all prefer red wine and the Nebbiolo D'Alba turned out to be a good choice.
author: Bruce H.

description:
CHECK YOUR BILL FOR OVERCHARGES! 
This is a great restaurant with delicious food.  One of my favorite restaurants.  I've never had anythng but excellent food and good service by waitstaff who are working very hard with many tables each. 
The dessert boat is a joy: something like 5 different samplings of their desserts; very Italian.  I recommend that you get less than the waiter and menu recommends, since there is a lot of food and you will waste money.

My only complaint is 2 back to back instances of false charges on my bill.  I pointed it out to the waiters who checked, agreed with me and came out with a new bill.  
I went out with about 6 others: coincidentally before we ate I told them about my last experience with overcharge errors and it happened again! The waiter blamed it on his aging eyes. 

Other than this proviso, you should definitely try this place. Take someone you really like, they'll love you for it!
author: Francois T.

description: Been here a few times, never disappointed.  Hardly ever a wait. Really good.  Tonight I had the seafood cioppinno...yum! My only complaint is I wish they had a more extensive 'wines by the glass' menu.
author: Aimee B.

description:
After it was highly recommended by the hotel Concierge, we ventured to the Cafe. It was hard to find down an alley.

I ordered the Grilled Salmon, only find it tasteless and fishy. A disappointment. Prices were reasonable and service not bad.
author: Joan M.

description: A wonderful gem like something you would find out of Italy. Sauces and pastas are magnificent. Rich, tasty and bold as one would expect for authentic Italian. We are coming back soon!
author: Tim G.

description:
My boyfriend and I loved all the meals we ordered.  We got mussells in pepperoncino as our appetizer, cesar and spring mix salads, monk fish osso bucco and their signature dish parpadelle bolognese, and the dessert sampler.  There were a lot of options in the menu that made it difficult to choose which item to get, however, an older really nice gentleman, who might be the owner, helped us decide.

We were very happy with all the awesome food and would have given them a perfect 5 stars except for the concierge.  We wanted refills in our coffee, but most of the staff were passing by in a rush that they did not see us trying to make eye contact, did not see our raised hand.  This went on for about 10 minutes.  To get someone's attention, I finally spoke a little louder  to a staff passing by and she replied, "I'm the concierge."
author: Joanna S.

description: Really nice little place, buried on a side street and so easy to miss, but defn a fan. Scallops appetizer and mussels with spicy sauce were both seasoned really well and excellent. seafood linguini was a little odd (came in a flat platter?) and so it required more stirring around to get the sauce on the noodles, but it tasted good. Service quite good as well. Will be back!
author: Grapes T.

description:
I had made reservations at Brindisi, and mistakenly thought that Cafe Tiramisu was it. Best mistake I've ever made. The house bread is delicious, handmade pasta, fanTASTIC wine list and oh yeah, their Tiramisu was the best I've ever had.

My mom kinda fell in love with the waiter, who was of course Italian and a great server. He recommended a really tasty bottle of Sangiovese and a Chardonnay for mom (I think that's when she really fell for him!).

We all loved our food. I shared the Cioppino with my hubby, and it was pretty good. Yes, I was raised on this (lucky me) and you just can't beat mom's. My friend loved her pasta dish and my mom was in love with her dinner. Sorry but the wine kept me from remembering what they ate :p

Go here. Sit outside. Take your time.Have a great experience.
author: Samantha D.

description:
Came here for dinner last night on a whim. It's a hidden gem within an alley way of several restaurants and it was great. I was with two friends and the weather wasn't too chilly so we were able to eat on the patio under a heater without jackets. Perfect. 

My two dates ;) jk had the new york peppered steak, with potatoes and some sort of delicious spinach side. I had the saffron risotto w/ prawns which was delish, but light. The gentleman was some sort of manager there and was super nice and took the time to chit chat with us for a while which was really pleasant. 

For (6) beers, (1) appetizer and (3) entrees, the bill was $158, not bad for the amount of food and quality of the food. Definitely a place to try if you're looking to try an upscale but not too upscale italian spot in SF.
author: Cat G.

description: Was here for a business lunch. Got the gnocchi and a beer, hey it was Friday. Pretty decent. I find the places on Belden pretty average.
author: Sunil R.

description: Had 6 oysters on the half shell, but the lemon was so old couldn't get any juice out of it. Had the smoked salmon and ahi tuna appetizer. Bread was cold - when asked for warm bread came as appetizers were finished. No lemon with this appetizer. Ravioli with salmon and ricotta was good. Took 50 mins before we got the appetizers.  We are natives, not tourists. Wouldn't have taken me ch effort to have been great.
author: Pam S.

description:
Cafe Tiramisu has great ambience, delicious food, and their servers don't push you for time. It's a relaxed, yet upscale environment, especially for nice dinners with relatives, a date, etc.

It's expensive, but that's a given. It's definitely a special occasion kind of place (well, at least for most of us). Still, the food really has heart. I absolutely loved the Sicilian clam chowder. I would go back just for that. It's got this perfect consistency, and it's light and decadent without laying the seafood itself on too thick or thin.

Dessert is delicious too. Try anything - you can't really go wrong here.
author: Jiordan C.

description: Fresh pasta made daily..I'm in!  When eating here my hubby and I dined outside and reminded me of Italia :) I enjoyed the grilled calamari for appetizer.  I had the squid ink pici pasta which is rare to find.  I first got introduce to pici when i visited Tuscany and a fan.  Hubby had short rib ravioli.  The tiramisu was good but wished it  had more expresso.  Coming back for their pappardelle wild boar!
author: Emmy D.

description: Had a work lunch here - enjoyed it. We arrived without a reservation around 12:30 and were seated right away. I had the grilled peaches and the veal scaloppini. Both were delicious. The service was very attentive. My lunch companions also enjoyed their meals - I'll be back!
author: Allie H.

description: My husband and I had dinner at Cafe Tiramisu from a friend's recommendation. I was concerned my husband wouldn't like it because he's a steak and potatoes type of guy. Much to my surprise he loved it! My dish was the red snapper and his was ravioli, both were delicious. Best homemade tiramisu, excellent service, comfortable ambiance. Can't wait to come back again!
author: Sharlyn B.

description:
This is a great little spot in the midst of many other great little spots on Beldan place. 
Great street level parking, as well as a basement room thats interesting. The food is great but the waiter scoffed when we ordered the cheapest bottle of red wine on the menu. They were conveniently out of it so he scoffed even harder when we then ordered the second cheapest ;)
You can also sit outside in front which is nice. They have heaters and an overhang.
GO here for greta Italian and an intimate setting.
author: Jack W.

description:
Arrived late was promptly seated. Ordered ravioli, was nice pasta with almost no fillings. Sauce was great, just would've liked to see more of the feature item of the dish.  
  Wine list is crazy expensive but nice choices if you don't mind $45 and up from there.
author: Mike L.

description: Located in an unknown alley, this place is literally a hole in the wall... But a little fancier. Cafe Tiramisu has GOOD Italian food and pleasant service. The owner of the restaurant attended my family and basically said, "Whatever you want, we'll make it." Sometimes you've gotta be treated like diva, and this is just the place.
author: Allison W.

description:
Stopped by for early lunch.  Quaint little restaurant 
alley in the heart of the SF Financial District.  Just finished Caesar Salad with salmon fillet and a few anchovies for taste, artisan bread with olive oil (infused with olive bits and garlic), and Napa Valley white wine.  Awesome meal! Attentive and friendly service to boot!
author: David S.

description:
FORGET IT

My wife and I started a nice day in San Francisco at the Palace of Legion of Honor seeing art and the Houghton House showing. I had made dinner reservations for 5:00 P.M. before we left home at 9:00 A.M. We were looking forward to a dinner recommended by KQED Check Please. The host led us to our table, placed the wine list and menus on the table and promptly left without a word before I was even seated. After fifteen minutes a waiter arrived In what might be described in a hurried manner. People at another table who came in after us were waited at least ten minutes before us. We were the only two tables seated in the restaurant. The wine I ordered was not the wine I received. I asked to look at the bottle to view the label. It was not what was written in the win list. Upon leaving and after spending over $100.00 for the two of us there wasn't even a thank you from the host at the door.
author: Raymond T.

description:
Cafe Tiramisu has a nice environment, good service,and an interesting alley location. However the food is lackluster, mediocre, and unimaginative.  
My Burchette it was pretty good, but my Seabass was don't and I'm interesting. I did enjoy the lobster mashed potato.  But my profiterole dessert seemed more like something that came from Costco.
By stepmoms shrimp was undercooked, and she had to send it back. My husband's cioppino was rather dull, not nearly as good as Anchor Oyster Bar, and his pumpkin cheesecake was dry and weak flavored.

Most of all, for $300 dinner for four people I would've expected much better.  It just reminds me that I should stick to the neighborhood restaurants such as the fantastic L'Ardoisse, and other amazing French and Italian restaurants and avoid the financial district.

I would think twice before trusting the show Check Please again.
author: Jamey F.

description: Dinner tonight for Hubby's birthday. He LOVED the salmon and I really liked the cioppino. Waiter, Nelson was very nice, gave recommendations and made you feel right at home. Anna, the Hostess is a fabulous Ambassador. She is friendly and kind and makes you feel like an old friend. A wonderful experience every way around. Wish we lived closer! A definite recommendation!
author: GarynGina H.

description:
Beldon Place is such an awesome little gem. I love it more and more each time I visit.

What I am not familiar with is the host/hostess nearly begging you to eat at their restaurant. I still haven't gotten used to it. It's kinda like homeless dude begging you for a dollar, but wearing high heels and a skirt. 

Anyway, we made our way to this spot simply based on the fact that nobody was outside begging and I am so glad we did.

Food was excellent. 

Risotto with Scallops and Chantrelle Mushrooms was very creamy and tasty. Scallops were cooked perfectly. Seared on the outside and tender on the inside. 

Paparedelle with Boar Ragu was delicious! Very tasty, well seasoned and the sauce and pasta were perfectly happy together.  

Service was off the charts. Our waiter, Dario, was very professional, didn't bother us too much and was very kind. We showed up just before closing and he didn't give us the "come on you fockers, it's time to go home" routine that truly makes me anxious. Service is key in this area b/c there are so many good options that I tend to focus on the service. So glad to see waiters busting ass and doing good work. 

I would definitely come back for another visit, which is the ultimate compliment from a diner. Enjoy!
author: Hector G.

description: We had a fantastic lunch here today. Husband had the pappardelle and I had the short rib. Most tender short rib I've ever had. Service was efficient (lead waiter not so friendly but he got the job done). Husband, who is a dessert snob, had the tiramisu and gave it 9/10 stars. That's saying something! We also had a side of Brussels sprouts which were fair. Funny, a couple of weeks ago we had lunch at Kokkari and it cost twice as much as Cafe Tiramisu and wasn't half as good.
author: Ottis M.

description:
I remember that Pike Place Market scene in "Sleepless in Seattle" where Tom Hanks, worried about re-entering the dating scene after his wife died, gets counsel from Rob Reiner on how to meet women. Rob says cryptically "Tiramisu!" to which Tom doesn't know whether he should be eating it or performing it with an extra-large vibrator and a dozen hard-boiled eggs. That's how I kinda feel when I'm in this always-crowded place. Given that I forgot my vibrator and eggs (...of all days!), that left me with just one other option - eating.

Of all the Belden Place places, this is probably the best food-wise. That's not really that high a watermark as I'm kind of meh on all the other places, maybe because I feel they should do more crowd control in that alley during the lunch hour. But Italian is hard to screw up unless you're Buca di Beppo or the Olive Garden. Cafe Tiramisu is better than that and actually delights me on occasion.

I had a soup-salad combo while dining with a colleague there, and it turned out to be a smart digestive move. I had the $7 bowl of Heirloom Tomato Soup, creamy with a drizzle of basil-infused olive olive and a couple of croutons. As a complement, I went for the $13 Roasted Yellow Peach and Arugula Salad with Prosciutto and Aged Ricotta. It was a nice blend of peppery and sweet and a good combo of textures. That turned out to be satisfying enough.

Dining inside did make a difference, and the service just seemed more punctual since most of the noise was coming from the outside. I didn't have any room for what I assume to be their signature dessert - tiramisu - but I did find my vibrator later. What happened after that is not particularly relevant to this review.

FOOD - 4 stars...well-prepared soup and salad does the trick for me
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...not particularly exciting decor-wise, but you may want to sacrifice the sun at lunch to secure a greater peace on the inside
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...serviceable with an Italian accent
TOTAL - 4 stars...I'll let this Belden Place eatery have four stars and let the others aspire to it
author: Ed U.

description:
Eccentric menu for an Italian restaurant. Cute alley location. We went there on NYE and I couldn't help but order the pre-set menu. Way overpriced for what you received. Didn't enjoy the salad or the risotto, halibut was good other than the prosciutto crust. Pistachio panna cotta was delicious.

Our waiter was sweet but the other waiter in the area complained within earshot.

If I ever returned I'd get dessert here but that's it.
author: Maggie M.

description: Thus far the best Italian restaurant i have tried. They have a little bit of seafood and steak on their menu too making it very easy for a group of people cuz of the variety. The service is top notch from the time the receptionist seated us to the waiter. Also we get to meet Josepie the owner who was very welcoming. It was my Grandma's 78th birthday and she was very pleased with the cake they gave us. Thanks and definetly we will be back!
author: Jd L.

description:
Its really sad for me to write such a bad review especially when the food is good
We had reservation for 9 people at 6:30, they even called to confirm the reservation
When we got there , we had to wait 20 min for them to set the table , by the time we sat down, it was 7pm, we have a 2.5 yr old and pregnant woman with diabetes. After all of us ordered by 7:20pm, we were still waiting for our food at 8:30pm. Wow we had a pregnant woman who almost fainted and a 2.5 yr old who was tired and hungry
The whole experience was too bad for us to go back or even recommend this place
author: Pauline I.

description: Had our Wedding Dinner Reception here. The Manager, Joseph was a awesome host & waitered our small group of entourage. He introduced the menu & knows every dish & dessert. Im glad he took the time to socialize with us & made us feel important & welcomed. We ordered different foods, drinks & a couple of dessert platters. Damn! We sincerely loved it. We were dropped off with our limo (rented). Heads up on parking-its very hectic. So prepare yourself to look around for a space to park your vehicle. Taxi is always a good option or walk it, "flat shoes please". Belden place is a place to check in, if you are looking for a unique european style food & energy. TIRAMISU is on a little alley along with other little restaurants. Belden place is like a taste of mini Paris. Make sure that you have your money$$$ ready. High price menu but worth it. I recommend Cafe Tiramisu. I or we will come back again.
author: Rene L.

description:
Food was good. We ordered the grilled calamari and it was okay (too salty) and the main dishes were good as well. However, the service was mediocre at best. We both felt really crammed and my poor husband kept moving his head, afraid he would get hit by a plate. Our server was disinterested in how we were doing. 

Portions were small but reasonable priced but there are way too many gems in the City with better food and much better service. It was a great experience mainly because of the company but sadly don't think I will be back.
author: Priscilla R.

description: We like to have our "team lunch meetings" here. I have tried the spaghetti with crab, ravioli with shortribs, and the pork chop. I love the pork chop here and I usually switch out the mashed potatoes for shoe-string fries. The bread is a hit or miss -- it's either really moist and hot, or really dry and cold. Convenient location for those who work in the heart of Financial District. Lunches will take over an hour so make sure you plan accordingly!
author: Katarina D.

description: Amazing authentic Italian food as well as attentive and friendly service. We even had the pleasure of having a long conversation with the owner/manager who made us feel right at home. My family and I highly recommend stopping here for dinner.
author: Emma K.

description: My kids were craving risotto- I phone the restaurant to ensure they had it. When we arrived, the owner greeted us and had the chef whip up a plain cheese risotto for them. I had the pesto risotto with shrimp. It was the best risotto I ever had and I'm sure I'll be thinking about it for a long time. Good service and very charming location in an alley way full of cafes and light with Christmas lights.
author: Brianne M.

description:
If you take her on a first date here, your chances of getting another are pretty decent.

There'll be enough going on around you to facilitate conversation, or at the very least exchanged glances of horror and dismay at the antics of locals and tourists alike!

I don't remember the food being particularly memorable, but I know I enjoyed it and I had a good time.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Went here on a whim for a late dinner- I was very impressed with all the dishes 
Had polenta w mushrooms for an appetizer. The scallops had rave reviews 
I has the penne arrebiata w goat cheese- spicy and yummy! Others in our party had pasta bolonease and the ribs and enjoyed them. Wine pairings were yummy
author: S G.

description:
After indulging in some libations at Rickhouse, my boyfriend and I set off in search of food. We read on Yelp! about a near by restaurant but were turned away at the door.  As we walked about the back door, we found ourselves on the cutest, most romantic alley. Lined with heaters, umbrellas and lights, we quickly grabbed a table from an exiting couple. 

This was a great unexpected find. I had the sage gnocchi and although it wasn't as good as my mother's, it definitely hit the spot! My boyfriend ordered the bolognese pasta and cleaned his plate! We skipped desert since I am not a fan of Tiramisu but a neighboring couple looked to be enjoying it. 

My boyfriend had even been to Italy and commented on how it felt like we were on the streets of Florence, not the streets of San Francisco. We certainly felt transported somewhere else and will most likely return the next time we are in The City.
author: Maura H.

description: Last night I had the pleasure of dining with a supplier of mine, since they were from out of town I had the task of choosing the restaurant.  Cafe Tiramisu was featured on a local program, and it received raving reviews.  Well my experience was at best so so.  The seafood chippino was flavorful but so is TJ's for a fraction of the cost.  The service was "there" but it felt like the waiter was really trying to up sell us every time he came by.  Honestly I was disappointed with the whole experience.
author: Madison G.

description: Great dinner, quaint European atmosphere. We had the Roasted Peach appetizer which was simple but wonderful. The kids loved the raviolis and the peppered pappardelle bolognese was excellent. Our dog was with us on vacation which they accommodated no problem. We will return next time!
author: Jill S.

description:
This restaurant successfully pleased a bride-to-be and 17 of her closest girlfriends.  Cafe Tiramisu FTW!

Upon arrival, I felt like I was walking down an alley in a small European city and this set the stage for a wonderful meal.  We had the "private" dining room downstairs.  I put private in quotes because the room is also the pathway to the bathrooms.  This was great for us since we then only had to maneuver ourselves down and back up the staircase in our 3 - 5 inch heels once.  I just hope that all the people who had to travel past our group to the restroom weren't too appalled by our behavior.  Most of them seemed amused at least.  

The food and drinks were delicious.  A friend got a glass of wine that had obviously gone bad and the waiter took it back no problem.  They didn't charge us a corkage fee on the champagne we brought because most everyone in our group ordered a drink.  The bread and pesto dip were the perfect start to the meal.  I stole bites of the prosciutto and fig appetizer and the bruschetta. Both were flavorful and perfectly balanced.  For my main dish I got the risotto with prawns.  I ate every single bite.  The only thing I took a bite of and didn't really care for was the gnocchi.  The gnocchi itself was prepared perfectly but the sauce had a weird smokey, spicy flavor that I couldn't quite put my finger on or enjoy.  

Our waiter was patient and had a great sense of humor.  The other staff were also helpful and all smiles.  

I plan to bring my honey here.  The outside seating area would be lovely for a date night with my love.
author: Emily J.

description:
Gotta love not paying for fine dining ^_^

Step 1: Drive around trying to find this fine dining food alley in SF by taking all the wrong one way streets.
Step 2: Walk into the restaurant with the most people trying to get in, assuming it is the French place that was recommended by concierge at the hotel.
Step 3:  Everything is amazing, our waiter Tony was a bit overwhelmed at first but was excellent once things died down a bit.  He had EXCELLENT wine parings, a dry and witty sense of humor that made our experience homey rather than stuffy.
Step 4: Realize you are definitely not in the restaurant you thought you were because they are so tightly packed together; walk over to the one you wanted to go to originally; and realize that you had a much better time and menu where fate took you rather than your brain.

Favorites:
Black Ink Risotto with Scallops and lobster bisque= DIVINE! I wanted to consume every last drop.  It was perfectly balanced, scallops were cooked perfectly, and it flowed together in my mouth in a happy seafood-gasm.

Zucchini Blossoms stuffed with ricotta with tomato sauce=The blossoms were stuffed, then perfectly deep fried. Not greasy at all, just perfectly crunchy and flavorful.

Sea Bass on Polenta and shell fish= Seafood heaven!  I got steamed muscles and clams, perfect sea bass on perfect polenta with the perfect tomato and mushroom sauce.  It was fantastic.  (Daily special, local and sustainable)

Rack of Lamb=Cooked perfectly with rosemary, gravy, potato and spinach.  Ordered rare, it came out perfectly.  Generous portions.  (Also picked daily, local, and sustainable)

A lot of love is put into this food.  And for being casually upscale, you get generous potions so you leave feeling nice and full.

Sometimes the best plans are the ones you didn't plan!
author: Susan C.

description: Awesome food and location. It is in the middle of a small lane hidden in the very center of financial district. Most sea food are nice. Definitely recommend p-ci at the house!
author: Dorian L.

description: Located in a quaint alleyway (sit outdoors if the weather permits!) with lights strung above, Cafe Tiramisu takes you far away from San Francisco and makes you feel like you're in Europe.  The pace is leisurely and what a great spot to unwind with a glass of wine and enjoy conversation and delicious food.  I was lucky to dine at Cafe Tiramisu with a friend who knows the owners so our meal was chosen for us.  We started with grilled calamari (incredibly fresh and delicious), tagliatelle pasta (nom nom), and swordfish with olives, capers, and tomatoes.  All were authentic, delicious, and filling!  We wrapped up with a dessert platter of six desserts, of which the tiramisu was my favorite.  How fitting!  Swing by Cafe Tiramisu after work to enjoy great ambiance, fantastic service, and delicious food.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Angela R.

description: Giuseppe, the owner, has a great restaurant and is a wonderful host! We loved the stories about his home town of Calabria.  This little hidden gem is worth the wait, drive, walk or whatever......  I had the carbonara... fantastic; my wife loved the raviolis!  Bene, molto bene!
author: Tony S.

description: Just amazing. We had the pan seared scallops for starters and they were wonderfully sweet. I had the gnocchi which were perfect. They were light and fluffy and melted in my mouth. My hubs had the braised short rib and that too was delicious. For desert, we had the cannolis(sp?) that were made with ricotta instead of marscapone and that made it light.  Inside is nice and quiet, outside is a bit boisterous. And for two, with No alcohol, it was over a hundred. So, it's a special occasion place for us.
author: Nutan C.

description:
3 1/2 stars. Came here for DAT lunch. $18.95 for a 3 course is a deal. I was so full. Food is good, but not great and we sat downstairs where it straight up smells. It is right where the bathrooms are, but who wants to eat while all you can smell is pee? JEEZ

I got a ragu pasta which was pretty good. The salmon was cooked perfectly, but could use a little more seasoning. For dessert, the raseberry sobert was a thumbs up. 

My cousin got the celery root soup, but it was too thick for me. She got the crab ravolli, and it was tastey and light. She took her Tiramisu to go, so I don't know what it taste like. 

Service was ok. Could have been better.
author: Karen H.

description: We thoroughly enjoyed our excellent dinner her. We were a group of 8 and our reservations made sure we were seated promptly. Every member of our party raved about their dinner selections as well as the wine selection. All of the ingredients in each dish was incredibly fresh! The atmosphere is vert European, if you was fast food go to McDonalds. This is a place where dinner is a social event! We will be sure to return.
author: Jim K.

description: Excellent Italian Rigatoni and Ravioli in a cozy atmosphere.  We ate at 3 different restaurants in Belden Place and it was by far THE best.  The restaurants in Belden Place are worth the visit to the adorable restaurant alleyway!
author: Tally S.

description:
This was a very cute little place.  Very European feel with the outdoor seating in the small alley way.  My husband and I went recently to take advantage of Dine About Town prix fix menu.  

I had a soup for appetizer that was rather bland ( I wanna say cauliflower); it wasn't terrible though. My entree totally made up for it though.  I had a steak with shoestring potatoes on top, a sauce of some sort and it was amazing. (We had had half a bottle of wine at this point and I can't remember exactly what the sauce was)

Dessert was up next and I had the profiteroles but they were not very fresh so that was a bummer.  But the espresso was great and the waiter didn't even charge us for them.  

In conclusion, lots of ups and downs but all in all it was a nice place with relatively good food.
Not sure if I would go back though since we live in the peninsula.
author: Sahar P.

description:
************* REVIEW 134 ****************

Fun, lively place on Belden Lane, reasonable price, simple food. I took my bestfriend & her man here after a long weekend in Napa. 

We had mussels with saffron & fennel broth which was nice & the broth was perfectly nice for bread dipping sauce. 

Then my BF had the linguine with pasta, she thought it was also just OK. Of course for us used to live in Manhattan, it's hard to live it up!

Her BF had the Pappardelle with olive, Arugula, Shaved Pecorino Cheese which was nice.

I had the cioppino, the classic San Francisco fisherman's stew of local rockfish, Tomales Bay Manila clams & mussels, Dungeness crab in Lobster broth. It wasn't as tasty as I would hoped for, compared to what i just had at Cioppino on the Wharf a week ago.

I haven't been here for a while, so it could be because I was tired from Napa, must be my off-day!

$20 corkage fee. 

Overall: 3.5 stars
For value: 4 stars
For Food: 3 stars
For Service: quick & efficient
For ambiance: 3 stars
For location: It was once very happening Belden Lane. Now half pack on a weekend night, surprisingly, must be the economy!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
I'm not sure where to start, this was an amazing meal. When I heard that their pasta was handmade I went in expecting fresh flavors and textures. My meal delivered! 

Prosciutto, Melon & Burrata with pesto and arugula 
Salmon crusted with pesto burrata fondue, roasted beets and gem lettuce
Chocolate polenta cake with chocolate ice cream

I didn't pay for the meal but whatever it cost it was worth.  I was with a group of eight people and everyone was satisfied.
author: Keith D.

description:
Great food.  I had their pork chops a year ago when they used to have it on the menu.  Delicious!  Soft, juicy, and full of flavor.  Typical pricing for the SF downtown area, but well worth it.  

I've been wanting to go back there for their pork chops, will wait untill they bring it back on their menu.
author: F A.

description:
By far the worst experience I had with any restaurant. 
I brought a guest here for a business lunch today. We were seated inside and sat for at least 5 minutes until a guy with an accent took our drinks order. It took another 5 minutes to get our drinks. Then about 15 minutes to flag him down for our order.
We ordered an appetizer and two items from the fish menu. Another 10 minutes went by and our appetizer came along with fresh bread. After about 15 more minutes we became aware of the time (we had about an hour to have lunch) and I walked over to the server to let him know we have to leave now and we still have not received our order. He became defensive and made it seem like it was our fault for notifying him of our time constraint. He said he was waiting for us to finish the appetizer to start the order... Well, we had been finished with the appetizer for the last 10 minutes, so that was no valid excuse. I probably would have overlooked the situation if he had not been so defensive and start pointing fingers. For the $80 dollars I spent at that restaurant, I do not want to hear someone talk down to me, raise their voice, and tell me it was my fault, in addition to horribly slow service.
Bottom line: avoid this restaurant. I would not even give them a second chance.
author: Danna S.

description: What a hidden gem!  I was a little leery when my map told me I had arrived at an alley, but walking through the multiple restaurant options set my mind at ease. We were in the mood for seafood but didn't want to pay Fisherman's Wharf prices. This place didn't disappoint. Excellent food, great service, nice heated outdoor seating.
author: KaRex R.

description: Great authentic Italian food. The southern Italian options had vibrant colors and tasty tomatoes while the northern Italian options lived up to its region with thick meat sauces and such.
author: Matt Y.

description: One of my favorite Italian spots in the city ! The food is awesome ! Homemade pasta :-) they offer plenty of sea food options here ! Must try is grilled calamari !!! The service is wow awesome ! The GM and co-owner is there non stop and he will actually serve you !
author: Danka V.

description:
I had a pretty mediocre experience here for a $60 meal.  Overall it didn't seem worth it and I'm most probably not coming back.

I came here for a large group dinner (~12 ppl), so possibly some of service issues I experienced were due to the large group.  

Service: I found the service strange.  I kept getting bumped by the servers when they were putting dishes on the table.  Or they could often interrupt my dining experience while I was in the middle of eating or talking to someone.  

Food: I had spaghetti that I found a bit overcooked and bland.  Definitely not worth the price of teh meal.  

Facilities: Friends reported bathroom was gross with overflowing toilets.  I didn't see it for myself though, but I trust what they said.
author: Wayne L.

description: Good ambience to dine outdoors in a tiny alley. Liked their homemade pastas, but definitely overpriced. The veal scaloppine was not good at all; good thing it wasn't my entree. Tiramisu was regular, nothing amazing but it topped off the meal.
author: Ava C.

description: This place was amazing. We had veal and it was the best I have had. They have really unique things on the menu and the owner came and talked to us for 15 min. Great guy.
author: Thomas F.

description:
Went here last night to have a good meal with my family after traveling in from New York.

We were one of their last tables, and i made sure my talkative family made sure to get their order in as soon as we could so the kitchen didn't have to stay late.

The food was very good food, no complaints there.

That was the end of anything positive i can say about Café Tiramisu.

The server took our order and went for the hard sell of the entree's over the pastas, it's one thing to recommend one dish over another, but the server didn't even try to act like the 17 dollar pasta was a viable option over the 28 dollar short ribs.

The server came back twice to confirm our order, and never even thought to use a notepad to write it down.  it's four entree's, how hard is that?

We asked for a bottle of the Riesling and the server shouted over our heads to a busser or another server to get the bottle, no server should be barking out orders over a guests head for anything.

We had to ask twice for butter with the bread.

Then, when we had just finished our dessert (the Tiramisu IS good, after all), they started packing up the patio and actually turned the lights off over us.

I understand that when a restaurant is closing the staff wants to leave and go home.  But it's one thing to nudge a table along and get them out; 
it's another thing to actually shut the restaurant down around a guest as they're signing the check.

I've had better service walking into a dinner 5 minutes before they close in midtown manhattan then here. 

If i never go back here again it will be to soon.
author: Alex S.

description:
I've been here twice, and both times it's been just ok.  A friend and I cruised down Belden checking out all the menus in the alleyway, and ended up deciding that we were in the mood for Italian.  It had been 18 months since my first time, so I figured Café Tiramisu deserved a second chance.

My reaction?  Meh.

The sweet potato and mushroom ravioli just wasn't as good as it should be, not with ingredients like that.  I wanted to like it SO much, and was just totally indifferent.  Even with added salt, it just didn't have the flavors it should.  My friend had the risotto and had a similar reaction to her dish.  Our food came out so quickly after we'd ordered it that we almost wondered if it had been pre-prepared.

In any case, this place is fine.  I'd go here again in a pinch.  But don't expect to be wowed.
author: Joëlle M.

description: This was a great, pretty traditional Italian place. Down to the manager/waiter personality. Italian spoken a lot. The food was so good.  I had fish (sea bass) and it was perfectly cooked. My friend had the ribs which I understand slow marinade over night.  It was awesome as I tried it. The ambience is very cozy. Overall a great experience.  I'll be going back again.
author: Rob L.

description:
This is my boss's go-to place for lunch...so I figured it'd be a safe bet when I decided to pick a place among the choices in Belden Ally.

I took a friend here for lunch and I wasn't impressed. I ordered the parpadelle with lamb(my favorite) and the noodles were drenched in grease. I tried to soak up the grease by eating the bread...and just gave up 1/3 way through. 

My friend ordered the Sand Dabs which looked a lot more palatable than my dish...

Perhaps I ordered the wrong dish..but it made a disappointing lunch...
author: Mimi T.

description:
Excellent service. A bit noisy but a great feel to the place. Had a two hour dinner with a friend - service was attentive not intrusive.  

I had the New York strip - well seasoned and cooked exactly as I asked. Good wine selection.
author: Richard C.

description:
Food : A solid four stars
Service : Two stars

The food here was absolutely delicious. I ordered the black ink risotto while my friend ordered the beef short ribs. Both were tasty.

We chose Cafe Tiramisu because of the friendly hostess and the intriguing specials. However, our waiter seemed to resent having to come outside to serve us (we were by no means the only party sitting outside) and his timing was awful. It took forever to get our drinks (they arrived immediately before the food). For the price, I would have expected better service from the waitstaff.
author: Dani D.

description:
Everything was delicious. We had the veal scallopini and it was fantastic. We also had a Caesar salad with fresh anchovies. This is highly recommended.

for dessert we are having the tiramisu elect great but we haven't started yet.
author: Karen N.

description:
Went for lunch with a friend today. I was not sure if it was Zoe's charming way or her eyes that drew us in, but we were glad we did. My friend enjoyed the New York steak while I was very impressed with the seafood risotto. Light fluffy bed of rice covered with a tangy sauce and delicious crab meat garnished with jumbo shrimp.
Our server, Frank was excellent and we loved the outdoor atmosphere. Thanks Zoe, appreciate your drawing us in. When I have time, I shall return for the Tiramisu.
author: M...I Love This Place S.

description:
One night I decided that my baby sis was in need of a nice meal. I took her out and we headed for Belden Place. There, I told her to "pick one" and she chose Cafe Tiramisu. I'm so happy that she did. 

The girl that the front was incredibly nice and sat us in a very cozy, romantic spot right away. The waiter was nice, although he smelled very heavily of cigarettes. (minus point there...) 

The bread that came in a basket once you sit down is fantastic. Fluffy and warm, it doesn't even need the pesto oil that comes with it.
We ordered the Eggplant Parmasian ($16ish) to start, which was more of a eggplant lasagna. Not that I'm complaining, because it was delicious. The waiter, when he brought it to the table, served it onto our plates, and then poured a creamy bechamel sauce on top of it, right onto our plates. Like I said... lasagna. It was creamy, full of flavour and very comforting. 

For mains, I ordered the Penne Puttanesca ($17ish) and my sis had the Gnocci ($17ish). Both were good, but the Gnocci won that round. The little Gnocci pieces were tender, juicy and had soaked up all the flavour of the great sauce that it sat in. 

I would definitely come here again. A date here would be very romantic. Nice atmosphere, good tasting comfort food and friendly staff.
author: Mariko F.

description: Horribly rude service. My plate was filthy.. didnt even bother to clean the splatter. The food was blah. Never going here again.
author: Megha M.

description: Cafe tiramisu is on picturesque Belden place! They were able to accommodate 10 of us at a long outdoor table.  I had the pappardelle and it was very good.  The prices are fair and we were in and out in under two hours.
author: Katherine W.

description: I loved this place! It is located in a little alley and we ate outside under the twinkle lights. Accommodated a large group without blinking. The good wine selection and excellent service by a guy with an Italian accent made it all come together to feel authentic. Food was outstanding. I could have just eaten the appetizers...calamari, octopus, and beef carpaccio were all delicious.
author: Sarah L.

description:
This is me and my boss' favorite place to go - when we need to get away from our office! The Cioppino is the best! But TONY (the waiter) is the first thing we order on the menu! Great atmosphere, real food and great wine! 

We can't wait to get back there, luv this place!
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Cafe Tiramisu ended up being a great place for a group of friends to have dinner, with excellent food and wine (we had a couple of bottles of the house Chianti), and friendly service to boot. We had reservations, but there was plenty of room on a Thursday night.

Our shared apps were delicious, and three ended up being the perfect amount for a group of six (beef carpachio, tuna carpaccio and the bruschetta). The complementary bread w/ oil/spice dip was good too, but nothing special. Several in the group also enjoyed Cesar salads, although they did lack the traditional anchovies.

For an entree, I had the braised boneless beef ribs with horseradish mashed potatoes, which was simply awesome. The meat was perfectly tender and mouth watering, with a delicious sauce. It was also a generous portion - I had to stop myself from eating it all so I'd have room for desert. My girlfriend and I then finished by sharing the chocolate mousse cake, pistachio ice cream and raspberry sauce, which was also outstanding.

Really, my only (mild) complaint is that the restaurant can get kind of loud, and I expect that with full crowd it would be difficult to carry on conversation in a group. But that's an issue with a lot of relatively small, popular restaurants. I'd come back here anytime.
author: Andy S.

description: Disappointed.  Had seen it featured on "Check Please, Bay Area" and wanted to try it.  I had the shortribs-stuffed ravioli.   They were large and quite flat - I could hardly taste any shortribs inside.  Did like the garlic chips and basil on top though.  The bread was nothing great either.  I liked the charm of the alley location, but that's all.  I felt the whole menu was too fancy and small for my liking.  Eliminate the rabbit, quail, octopus, and lamb dishes (which I do cuz I'm not adventurous), and there is not much left.
author: Marie W.

description:
DO NOT CELEBRATE ANY SPECIAL OCCASIONS AT CAFE TIRAMISU!  Extremely disappointing food and poor service!  This is NOT AUTHENTIC ITALIAN FOOD!

The evening started off with the waiter breezing by on his way back into the kitchen to ask, 'Anyone want any drinks?'.  There was no hello or introduction stating my name is xxx and I'll be taking care of you this evening which left me to wonder, was this person going to be our dreaded waiter for the evening, which he unfortunately was.  We asked if there were any specials for the evening and we were abruptly told, 'Everything's on the menu'.  He took our order and a few minutes after ordering, the waiter breezed by again and said, "You're having the swordfish, right hon?"  Really?, how  unprofessional.  Two of us had a fish entree which seemed to be seasoned with just salt and pepper and another had pasta which was very mediocre.  Our waiter also forgot the coffee we ordered with dessert.  So we had to flag him down and ask about the coffee and were done with dessert by the time it arrived.

The owners need to wake up and realize that people have an assortment of choices of italian restaurants in this vast city.  If they'd like to stay in business they need to step up their game in terms of customer service and improve their food.   I WOULD NOT RETURN TO THIS RESTAURANT EVEN IF MY NEXT MEAL WAS COMPLIMENTARY.
author: Catherine M.

description: Our meal was delicious, the service excellent and the location charming. Plus they welcomed our dog who was with us on the patio.
author: ken s.

description: Went for lunch one day at work. One of the great side streets in SF packed with really good eateries. I had a pasta dish and it was amazing. Deserts are very very good.  Excellent servers and hostesses.
author: Richard M.

description:
This place has major competition because there was a full alley of restaurants that had amazing menus. Cafe Tiramisu is not a big place so I appreciated the quite atmosphere. Service wasn't horrible but you have to be prepared to relax and take your time. 

They brought out bread with a I olive oil based sauce that really got me excited with what was to come because every restaurant I go to they just bring out olive oil but Cafe Tiramisu added something to set them apart. 
Appetizers: Arugola Salad, peaches and Prosciutto salad - very tasty but nothing unique. Polenta cake appetizer is amazing and it has been a month since I was there and I can't stop thinking about it. It had spinach, wild mushroom and gorgonzola. I wanted to lick my plate but there were white table cloths. 

For dinner we had the Braised Beef Short Ribs over Horseradish Mashed Potatoes. You didn't need a knife because the ribs just pulled apart and melted in your mouth. We also had the Pork Chop that was good and we don't regret our choice but I definitively would try something else the next time I go because the menu had tons of delicious options.   

For dessert we had the sampler for two but really we should have just gotten it for one because it was ridiculous how much we had left and that was even after we shared with the next table. I appreciated that they had the sampler pistachio gelato, pistachio creme brulee, chocolate cake, biscotti, canolli because every piece was heaven.
author: Marisa G.

description: So had this place for a quick power lunch got the fettuccine Alfredo with penne noodles and added chicken.  It was pretty tasty though I personally really like the little Italian place on the Kearney side is better. During lunch hours it gets busy all throughout Belden place (alley way behind Kearney in between Pine and Bush streets) in which case the service was less than great but not too bad. .. Honestly not sure if I would pick this place again over all the other amazing looking places in Belden place, still worth a try though.
author: Johnny M.

description:
Cafe Tiramisu was a suggestion from our hotel concierge.  As we approached the charming alley way we knew we'd be in for a treat.  The hostess seated us a half hour before our scheduled reservation
and we were greeted by the friendly waitstaff.  The menu has many wonderful choices.  We started with the best bruschetta I've ever had!  For the main course my husband had the wild boar (which was amazing!!!) and I had the lobster ravioli.  Both meals were fabulous and the staff were so warm and friendly.  I would definitely recommend Cafe Tiramisu.  Also very child friendly yet classy!
author: Coke S.

description: The hotel receptionist recommended this as a casual, walkable restaurant close to the hotel.  We were pleasantly surprised.  It was the absolute best brushetta ever.  I had garlic rack of Lamb, the best ever.  My husband had Sole, the best Sole that he had ever had.  I am taking off 1 star because service was somewhat slow.  I think they received a large unexpected party, so we had trouble getting our check.  We would definately go back again.
author: Liz i.

description: Truly one of our favorites - a little outdoor Italian cafe with amazing food.
author: Mark P.

description: YUM -- the risotto here is absolutely delicious. The prices are a little heavy for a quick lunch at work but there are some salad/side options you can do to mix it up. That seared scallop on top of the risotto was also the tops.  YUM.
author: Mel G.

description: This quaint Belden Lane restaurant has impeccable service and a great menu.  They always feature new specials, and have an amazing choice of vegetarian items as well.
author: L L.

description:
My sister was in town visiting and we went to dinner here.  What a mistake.  It was a Sunday and there were only a few tables in the restaurant.  I don't know if we had 3 servers or what but there was so much confusion over serving our table I thought we were on one of those "how will they react" TV shows.  Anything one of us ordered was delivered, after a long lag, to the wrong recipient, it was comical by the end.  

I had the black ink spaghetti and while pretty, was nothing special in the flavor department.  My sister had the sea bass and later reported not feeling well as a result.  At the end while waiting awhile for our check (almost no tables left at this point) one of our multiple servers came by to wipe bread crumbs from our table remarking "you guys were clean!"  That's because we didn't get any bread.  Thanks.
author: Kim U.

description: Great staff, food and ambiance.  A little gem in the midst of the city, we really enjoyed the entire experience and the desserts put everything right over the top!
author: Jan N.

description:
Scumbag Cafe Tiramisu

Says open till 10 on website

... Closed at 9:22
author: Marshall J.

description: Excellent food, wine and service! The octopus appetizer is amazing. Ive been here twice and have really enjoyed the experience. I'll be back.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Let me just start off by saying Belden Place is pretty cool and has a fun ambiance when you go down and visit. My fiance and I had flown into town for a fun night in SF and felt like Italian food so we decided to check out Cafe Tiramisu because it was walking distance from our hotel in Union Square. 

My fiance is 100% Italian so we were excited when we walked in, speaking some Italian and being friendly with the staff. Our experience from there on was rather disappointing. I don't recommend this place unless you're actually from Italy or really speak the language, the owner/waiter was only paying attention to the 2 tables who seemed to be from the "old country." 

It took 15 minutes just to get water, never mind asking for a cocktail and a menu. I finally got up and went to the bar tender to politely ask if there was a waiter in our area or if we could get some help. The owner/waiter came over to our table and was a complete dick. He proceeded to hound me saying "What are you in a hurry?" I said no, we just wanted to order a drink and some appetizers while we look at a menu...seems like a normal thing when you go to a restaurant. He proceeded to be pissy with us, not sure why we didn't just get up and leave. I think we were starving by that point and didn't want to have to hunt down another restaurant. I finally got a cocktail 25 minutes later and some appetizers but you could tell the guy was completely offended by me getting up and asking for some service. 

Now my father in law is from "the old country" in Italy and is a very kind man. I know how they can be sometimes but the owner/waiter went out of his way to be a jerk and for that it pretty much ruined our night and dining experience. I will never go back as there are plenty of kind Italian people in SF that would be more than happy to have your business. I only give it two stars because after we finally got the food it was okay. My recommendation would be to go spend your money elsewhere, these people were definitely not into customer service so they must not need the money.
author: Garrick B.

description: Located in a wide business alley, we had a wonderful dinner there. We sat in the outdoor patio area. Service was wonderful. Italian servers (I speak some Italian and was able to carry a conversation with our server who was very kind). The soup was amazing. My husband's pasta was so yummy. The whole evening was terrific and I look forward to going back there again...
author: Sonia L.

description:
I would give 3 stars for the food and location, but the service level makes it 2 stars!  I came here last night for a friend's birthday dinner.  We ordered several different appetizers to share - ahi tuna carpaccio, beef carpaccio, black ink risotto, calamari, fresh oysters, and a salad.  The black ink risotto was the best appetizer out of what I listed.  For my entree, I had the Rack of Lamb and that was pretty good - not the best, but good.

The service was so SLOW...luckily, we were a group of 8 girls so we had a lot to talk about to kill time.  Also, the server we had just didn't really care...his attitude sucked!  I would much rather go to Plouf, Sauce, and other places on Belden Place!  Ugh...
author: Sandy L.

description: Surprisingly good, albeit grossly overpriced, San Francisco Italian tourist food. Staff took way too long to bring us the food (they could have done with less phony pageantry and more productivity in the kitchen). However, my crudo was very tasty, and the tortellini with short rib served in truffle oil was absolutely delicious, no doubt about it. Everything else in our large group looked pretty good, too.
author: Yan T.

description:
ENTREE
Carbonara - decent, although there wasn't enough sauce so at the end the pasta stuck together. Taste was good. 

DESSERT
Dessert Sampler - they really do give you a sample of everything. pistachio gelato, pistachio creme brulee, chocolate cake, biscotti, canolli

I'm not sure about dinner, but dessert was worth it.
author: Jess H.

description: Lovely people, great food, and fun atmosphere! Crab tortellini was amazing!
author: Red R.

description: Truly incredible, authentic Italian food. The ambience was excellent, service by the owner -Giuseppe- was perfect, and the food was just absolutely amazing. Don't leave without getting the bruschetta; every single bite is a little piece of heaven. We also ordered the Caprese & Burrata, the Short Rib Ravioli, the Pork Scaloppine, a limoncello, and an espresso. Every dish and drink was prepared to perfection and absolutely delicious. We will definitely be returning!
author: Simone ..

description:
Five years and Cafe Tiramisu hasn't changed at all, right down to the same man waiting on us both times. Man, that's amazing, really brought some memories back. It was a quiet evening when we strolled in here off of the glitz of Van Ness, so service was definitely up to par; while it's definitely priced like a tourist trap, I had to see if they were still there.

Bruschetta was classic and tasty, and the basic bread was delicious. The oysters were fresh, of course, and the Caesar salad was decent but not the best we've had. The risotto was fantastic, lots of spices and a ton of flavor throughout. The ravioli was OK, a very good flavor but _very_ small portions.

The only issue we had was when we ordered one of the less expensive bottles of wine, and the one brought out was the same but an earlier year, thus nearly twice as expensive when the bill came.
